characters: THE ROAR OF AN ENORMOUS CROWD
THE SOUNDS OF A BASEBALL GAME
THE PALE FACE OF A BEAUTIFUL WOMAN
THE FACE OF A BEAUTIFUL WOMAN
AGED CELL BARS CLANGING AS A DOOR OPENS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARTER CHAMBERS is a black mechanic in his late 50’s with a worn, but thoughtful demeanor. His job is beneath him and he’s known it for the last 30 years. He leans back against the El Camino he is working on.

dialogues.speaker: MANNY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: So then what happened? His partner MANNY is beneath the car on a roller. He slides in and out of view over course of the following...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Tesla took his design to the richest man in town, mister J.P. Morgan.

dialogues.speaker: MANNY
dialogues.text: The stockbroker guy?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: That’s right. Morgan was the major financier for Tesla’s primary rival, a fellow by the name of Tom Edison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Between them, Morgan and Edison controlled the entire power grid for New York, Boston, Philadelphia, and so on.

dialogues.speaker: MANNY
dialogues.text: (jingling his pocket) So they had some serious jing.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: They had “serious jing.” Which is why, when Tesla walked into Mr. Morgan's office and unveiled an invention designed to provide free, wireless electricity to the entire population of the planet - remember now, this is 1912 - Mister Morgan had no choice but to finance it immediately.

dialogues.speaker: MANNY
dialogues.text: Hold up. He agreed?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Without hesitation.

dialogues.speaker: MANNY
dialogues.text: But wouldn't free energy put him out of business?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Invariably.

dialogues.speaker: MANNY
dialogues.text: Yo, that’s one stupid stockbroker.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: A year later, Tesla invited Mr. Morgan out to Long Island, where he had nearly completed the first in a series of towers which would tap into the Earth and beam its energy through the air to a nearby receiver.

dialogues.speaker: MANNY
dialogues.text: Crazy... So what happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morgan knew the invention would make both Tesla and himself famous beyond their wildest dreams...change human history forever. So, he did what anyone in his position would do. He went back to his office, made a few phone calls, then home to his wife... The next day Tesla received notice that Morgan had pulled his funding. He was thrown out on the street and the lab was demolished. The morning papers carried stories about Tesla’s clinical insanity, quoting “anonymous sources” who claimed to have seen Tesla consorting with prostitutes and demons.

dialogues.speaker: MANNY
dialogues.text: And Morgan protected his company. That's SO...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Machiavellian? I agree.

dialogues.speaker: MANNY
dialogues.text: I was gonna say wack, but whatever spanks your monkey. What happened to Tesla?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: He became a pariah. No one dared cross Morgan. Nikola Tesla lived the rest of his life in isolation and died in poverty. The proverbial tree that falls without a sound.

dialogues.speaker: MANNY
dialogues.text: He never tried to start over. Carter shakes his head as the phone rings... MANNY (CONT’D) Yo, that’s a messed-up story.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Most true stories are. Happy endings are for suckers. Carter lights a new cigarette as he answers the phone...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is Carter... Hey, how was the interview?... Oh... Well, there’s plenty of fish in the... Dr. Young? (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did he want?...Uh huh...What does that mean?... It can’t be all that bad... He takes a drag of his cigarette then suddenly stops. His expression changes as he listens...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s not possible. He removes the butt from between his lips as smoke dribbles from his mouth. He looks at the cigarette for a moment then drops it to the floor. ANGLE ON the cigarette butt, slowly burning itself out. In the b.g., Manny pulls himself out from under the car, staring up at Carter.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Today? That’s no good, the team’s got their first scrimmage before... Yeah... No, I know. Okay... Yep. Okay.

dialogues.speaker: MANNY
dialogues.text: Yo, what the hell is that?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (hanging up the phone) Ah, it’s nothing, it’s just... He steps on the cigarette as he walks in a daze past Manny and out the door of the garage into the blinding day which fills the frame with its white light...

dialogues.speaker: COUNTY DIRECTOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Come to order. Hudson County Planning Board.

dialogues.speaker: AN EXPENSIVE LOOKING COPPER THERMOS
dialogues.text: As the lid is unscrewed releasing a waft of rich steam which curls up into the waiting nostrils of EDWARD COLE who inhales deeply.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Kopi Luwak. It’s the rarest beverage in the world. At a thousand bucks a pound it better be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the aisle, the COUNTY DIRECTOR is flanked by five fellow BOARD MEMBERS who go through the minutiae of beginning the meeting. Edward is in his mid to late 50’s. He’s immaculately dressed and groomed, though his Italian suit appears slightly too large for his gaunt frame. He unscrews a matching cup from the bottom of the thermos and pours a small amount of the brew before handing it over to RICHARD, one of several executives in Edward’s retinue.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (coaxing with his hand) First the aroma. Richard bends his head to the cup, sniffing it.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Note the earthy tones and the complexity of the body.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: It's just coffee, right?

dialogues.speaker: COUNTY DIRECTOR
dialogues.text: Mister Cole?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (to Richard) It’s not ‘just coffee.’ Watches Richard take a tentative sip.

dialogues.speaker: COUNTY DIRECTOR
dialogues.text: Mister Cole. We’re ready to begin.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (focused on Richard) Well?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: (clearly doesn’t get it) Wow. Really, uh, good.

dialogues.speaker: COUNTY DIRECTOR
dialogues.text: Mister Cole!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Richard) You're a friggin’ Philistine, you know that. Grabs the cup back and stands to face the board.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thank you, Mister Director, fellow board members. Very much appreciate you taking the time... I’m not big on sugarcoat, so you'll forgive me if this comes across as somewhere south of warm and fuzzy... (looks directly at them) All of you should be immediately and pointedly fired. They should haul you up by your boot-straps and dump your bloated salaries into the street. The appalling decline of Jefferson Hospital is a direct result of your gross incompetence and utter lack of fiscal erudition.

dialogues.speaker: COUNTY DIRECTOR
dialogues.text: I beg your pardon! This--

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Okay, I got a deal. I’m going to talk for a few minutes, and the moment I speak the slightest untruth you can shout me down. Good? Fair? Good... Your shop is hemorrhaging cash. Overhead costs are in the stratosphere. Your lease and land costs were criminally overbid. One of the board members raises his hand to protest but the County Director waves him off.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Donations have atrophied to the point that you’ve fallen hopelessly behind the tech curve in research, pediatrics, oncology, MRI... He pauses and savors a long sip of his Kopi Luwak coffee, eyeballing the board over the rim of the cup until his eyelids close in ecstasy from the flavor.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mmmm... Put simply, your hospital loses money every time a patient walks through the door.  The board members range from uncomfortable to furious, though none say a word.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: More truths... The Cole Group is the largest private hospital management firm in the region. We have a proven track record of corporate governance and exceed every requirement of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act... Our shops maintain state-of-the- art technology systems, and wield unparalleled clout in negotiating with unions and the insurance companies... What’s more we've privatized fifteen other public hospitals in the past seven years, each of which now provide the highest standard of medicine to their communities. He pours a second cup of coffee and brings it to his lips.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE BOARD MEMBER
dialogues.text: Despite being grossly understaffed?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (pausing before drinking) We employ the best of the best of the best. The stronger the staff, the less need there is for-- Suddenly, he coughs into the cup, spraying coffee onto the table.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Excuse me. Pulls a silk handkerchief to his lips as his suits search their pockets for tissues to wipe the table.

dialogues.speaker: COUNTY DIRECTOR
dialogues.text: What about beds? There have been reports that you increase the number of beds to the point of overpopulation.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (wiping coffee) That’s because I run hospitals, not bed and breakfasts. The sole concern of my company is to provide the best health care in the world, which we do. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sole concern of my shareholders, who include three of you, I might add, is to turn a profit, which, as you know, we also do... Our methods are stringent and effective and one has never suffered at the hands of the other, and you know it... Truths? The truth is you need me boys and girls...a fuck of a lot more than I need-- Coughs into the handkerchief again.

dialogues.speaker: COUNTY DIRECTOR
dialogues.text: Mister Cole? Edward stares in shock at the ugly puddle of clotted blood staining the white silk of the handkerchief...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pair of elevator doors open at the far end of a long hallway emitting a hulking man in a tailored black suit, lugging a set of four massive suitcases as he counts room numbers. This is THOMAS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas barrels in, passing a curtained off area near the door, and drops the bags onto the empty bed next to the window. Opening the first suitcase, he sets up the room with practiced efficiency-- He plugs in a cell phone cradle and sets it on the bedside table along with a hi-tech alarm clock... Lines half a dozen shoes and slippers down the length of the bed... Unloads a stack of thick books on living with cancer, cancer treatment, cancer nutrition, new cancer protocols... Sets a laptop computer on the table, surrounding it neatly with pens, notepads and Post-Its... Places a massive, Royal Classic copper coffee siphon on the window sill, along with copper-lined cups and saucers and spoons and a dark wooden box covered in Arabic writing and Sumatran customs stickers... VOICES are heard in the hallway - a commotion coming closer. Thomas quickly removes a vase and flowers. He jogs through the separator curtain and into the bathroom where he fills the vase with water, completely missing the figure lying in the bed behind the curtain.  10. The noise in the hallway is reaching a fever pitch as Thomas emerges from the bathroom and nearly loses the vase as he sees Carter lying in the near bed.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (eying the flowers) You shouldn’t have. He’s thin and drawn and hooked up to a network of tubes and even his eyelashes have fallen out exposing his sallow skin that’s dappled with angry chemo burns. There are flowers everywhere and the wall behind him is a collage of get well cards and photos of a girls soccer team.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: I uh... I’m sorry. What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: You know, fighting for my life... You? Just as the hallway brigade bursts into the room - seen in silhouette and through the gap in the curtains - as doctors and nurses and handlers hover over--

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (from his gurney) And tell Holcomb I want to know more about this bleo-maya-something.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Bleomycin.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Bleomycin. Thomas says it eats your lungs. How do I stoke fear in the hearts of my employees if I’m breathing through a hole in my throat for the rest of my life.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: That’s not exactly what--

dialogues.speaker: NURSE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: We're going to move you into the bed now.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I can do it myself goddammit. I’m not dead yet.  11. Then a huge clattering is heard as Edward falls off the gurney. He swears bitterly as the doctors and nurses grab him quickly and lift him into the bed.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Where the hell is Thomas?

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: You rang my liege. Pushing through the curtains, leaving a gap through which Carter views Edward being slid into bed.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You ditched me again.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Wishful thinking on my part.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You let these people drop me. Did you see them drop me?

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: I wouldn’t lose a testicle over it.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: That’s funny. That’s absolutely, goddamn hysteri-- Lapses into a coughing fit which doubles him over, allowing him a look through the curtains at Carter.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who the hell is that?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Who the hell are you?

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: (to Edward) One thing at a time. Lean back now. Edward and Carter glare at each other before Thomas gingerly leans him back into the bed.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: That was the first I laid eyes on him. An inauspicious beginning to be sure, but most stories begin that way... It got worse before it got better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. HOLCOMB’S OFFICE - DAY DR. HOLCOMB is tall and ultra-confident with a runner's physique and shoulder-length hair. He examines Edward's brain scan on a light board.

dialogues.speaker: DR. HOLCOMB
dialogues.text: Luckily the tumors appear relegated to the surface of the brain. Shouldn’t be to difficult to--

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I just gave you my left nut, if you think I’m going to let you crack my head open and--

dialogues.speaker: DR. HOLCOMB
dialogues.text: Stop talking.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (glowering) Beg your pardon?

dialogues.speaker: DR. HOLCOMB
dialogues.text: This isn’t a skinned knee. I can’t fix it with a band-aid and a lollypop. Choriocarcinoma travels through your bloodstream which means it’s everywhere and it has almost finished killing you. They stare each other down. Egos facing off... Finally, Edward stands...

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You’1l understand if I want a second opinion. He heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: DR. HOLCOMB
dialogues.text: You don’t have that kind of time.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Go fuck yourself. Walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Electric clippers shave smooth avenues onto Edward's scalp. His mood has not improved.  13.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: There’s a guy in my room. NURSE SHING continues shaving his head without a response. She’s Asian, late-thirties with a quiet confidence born of years comforting the sick and dying.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I said there’s a guy in my room. (points to the curtain) Right in there.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE SHING
dialogues.text: Mmmm.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I want him moved.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE SHING
dialogues.text: Mister Chambers bothering you? Pokes her head through the curtain to see Carter lying in bed reading Robert Massie’s Nicholas and Alexandra. NURSE SHING (CONT’D) Carter, have you been bothering Mister Cole?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (without looking up) Who the hell is Mister Cole?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: It's not a question of-- Not to pull rank, but this is my hospital. Which, at the very least, should rate me my own room. (to Carter) No offense.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (dismissive) Mmmm.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE SHING
dialogues.text: (disapproving) Mmmm.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: What’s “Mmmm?” Is that some kind of secret cancer code? Why don’t you run down and tell doctor what’s his nuts that I want to see him ay-sap.  14.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE SHING
dialogues.text: (brandishing the clippers) Look bub, maybe this is your hospital, but this is my ward and we have strict rules. Two beds to a room. No single rooms. No exceptions.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (catching himself ina mirror) Jesus... Yeah, those are my rules, (checking her name tag) Phyllis. I wrote the rules.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE SHING
dialogues.text: Great, then you shouldn’t have any trouble remembering them. Dr. Holcomb will be in in a minute to dot you up. She walks out leaving him with Carter who is chuckling to himself. Edward glares.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: No offense...

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (grumbling) Mmmm. Carter chuckles some more...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward's bald cranium has been clamped into a large, steel halo. A laser marks a point on his forehead and Dr. Holcomb marks corresponding dots on his skin with a Sharpie.

dialogues.speaker: DR. HOLCOMB
dialogues.text: I’m going to ask you to remember something for me. Edward is staring with disgust at his reflection in a glass window.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, what’s that?

dialogues.speaker: DR. HOLCOMB
dialogues.text: The young lion waits in a dream beneath the cold white lantern.  15.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DR. HOLCOMB
dialogues.text: The young lion waits in a dream beneath the cold white lantern. Repeat it back to me.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: The young lion waits in a dream beneath the cold white lantern. What the hell does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: DR. HOLCOMB
dialogues.text: Doesn't mean anything. It’s a memory test. Any time we go near the brain... there’s always a risk. This is how we’ll know if you’ve gone vegetable on us.... Again.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (seething) The young lion waits in a dream...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Testicular cancer is almost unheard of for anyone over thirty, but then Edward always despised conformity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Holcomb and his surgical team operate on Edward who lies in fragile stasis.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: By the morning of the surgery it had spread so far throughout his body that the doctors gave him a five percent chance to live...but then they didn’t account for how pissed off they’d made him. PUSH INTO Edward’s inert face which, even under sedation, appears annoyed at the intrusion...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peering down at Edward as his eyes open slowly, wandering in their sockets before focusing on the perfect visage hovering over him. Her name is ANNA, she’s 26.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: There you are. He struggles to speak.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here. She lifts a glass of water with a straw to his lips. He sips slowly. His head is wrapped in bandages.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We've been so worried. You were asleep forever.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: How...? Did it...?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Oh, they said it went really well. He coughs. She draws back involuntarily, uncomfortable around sickness. He hears a noise and looks over at Carter who is surrounded by his three children, LEE, 26, ROGER, 23, and RACHEL, 13. His wife VIRGINIA, 50's, sits at the end of the bed. All are talking quietly over plates of food.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They are so nice. She’s a nurse. They come to eat with him almost every night. I should-- The doctor said to page him when you woke up. His eyes begin to close again...

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No wait, there’s something I have to-- HIS POV FADES OUT... Virginia looks over to see Anna kiss her hand and press it to Edward’s cheek.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGINIA
dialogues.text: Everything all right, dear?  17.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: He fell asleep before I could tell him.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGINIA
dialogues.text: I’m sure he’ll understand.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: It's only a few months, right? It’s not like I’m never coming back. It’s obvious she’s never coming back.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I guess I'll...

dialogues.speaker: VIRGINIA
dialogues.text: (to her family) We should probably push off too. (to Carter) If you need any more books--

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Nah, I’m good all the way up to Stalin. Lays his hand on an impressive stack of books atop his bedside table, all concerning early 20th century Russia.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, Todd Phillips called. He was asking about the--

dialogues.speaker: VIRGINIA
dialogues.text: Already took care of it. He nods his thanks. Barely meets her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I can’t come on Saturday. We’ve got the semi’s against Newark.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: That's right... Watch out for their front line, and their sweeper likes to take the ball up the field.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: All the girls wish you could be there. Virginia puts a light hand on Rachel’s shoulder, cautioning her not to upset him.  18.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: You ladies are much better off without me. Coach Sanders knows ten times more about the game as I do.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Everyone knows that’s not true... I love you, daddy. Kisses him, followed by her brothers, all exchanging heartfelt “I love you’s.” Finally, Virginia takes his hand. He grasps it briefly, without any intimacy. She leans over to kiss him, but the closeness is awkward. Her eyes fall as she kisses his cheek, feeling the lack.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What is a blackberry?... What are lingonberries?... Who is Halle Berry?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward opens his eyes to see the television is turned on to Jeopardy. Carter is sitting up in bed, firing the answers back at the screen.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (barely a whisper) Excuse me... (stronger) Excuse me. (a hoarse shout) I beg your pardon!

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Huh? Oh. (lowers the volume) Doc wanted you to wake up, said I shouldn’t pussyfoot. Just as Dr. Holcomb enters like a zephyr.

dialogues.speaker: DR. HOLCOMB
dialogues.text: So, it couldn’t have gone better. We got in, got out and the tumor came back benign. All that remains now is to make sure you’re not mentally--  19.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: The dumbass lion waits in a dream beneath the stupid white lantern. Dr. Holcomb nods approvingly. Marks the chart.

dialogues.speaker: DR. HOLCOMB
dialogues.text: Surliness is a good sign. How’s the catheter feel? He checks the integrity of the bulging plastic drain implanted into the center of Edward’s sternum.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Like someone took a dump in my chest.

dialogues.speaker: DR. HOLCOMB
dialogues.text: (barely listening as he scribbles on the chart) Wonderful. Okay, we saved your brain, now we're going to kill your body. Your markers are through the roof so I'd like to begin the first course of chemo in the morning. Good?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I can’t wait. Dr. Holcomb’s expression does little to hide the fact that Edward has no idea what he’s in for. Holcomb surges for the door...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Say, Doc. Do you think you could-

dialogues.speaker: DR. HOLCOMB
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I’m running late. Walks out.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (to Edward) Real Mother Theresa, that one. Edward tries to sit up but is held in place by the web of tubes running in and out of his body.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I wouldn’t do that if I were you.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I have a choice?  20. Carter turns back to Jeopardy. Edward takes a moment to accept his situation, then turns his head and studies Carter.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How long have you been here?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: What is the quadratic equation! (to Edward) Huh? Oh, in and out for the last few months.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Has it been uncomfortable?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Which part?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: The chemo.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: They say it’s different for everyone. Once you get used to the ‘round the clock vomiting and watching your veins turn black and the feeling that your bones are made of napalm, it’s not bad at all.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (paling slightly) Fantastic.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Say, I been meaning to ask you, what the hell is that contraption over there? Points over to the high-tech coffee maker.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: It's a siphon. Makes coffee. Fumbles his hand for the nurse call button.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I figured that much. What else it do?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Nothing. Just coffee.  21.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I‘1ll be damned... Did you know that coffee was originally discovered by a shepherd in Ethiopia? Edward just stares at him... Carter continues, as much for his own pleasure as for Edward's edification...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: His goats had been eating the cherries of an unfamiliar bush and soon became unmanageable, running and jumping all over creation. The shepherd chewed some of the leaves which gave him a strange vitality so he took some branches to the local monastery where the abbot decided to roast them. When the cherries started to burn, the beans inside produced such a pleasant aroma that they brewed them into a stew which eventually spread to Columbia, Asia, even Sumatra, like that hooch you got over there.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: It’s called Kopi Luwak.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I know what it is.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You’ve tried it?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (makes a face) Not even if I was dying of thirst in the Gobi desert.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Why not, it’s the most expensive--

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I’m more of an instant coffee man. Edward's I.V. tubes have become tangled in the call button. Carter rolls his eyes, but eases himself creakily out of bed and shuffles over to untangle them expertly.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Your wife’s a nurse?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Twenty-six years. Used to work in this ward.  22.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Retired?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: In a manner of speaking. Hands Edward the call button and shuffles back to his bed.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: You fired her, when this became “your” hospital.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: A LARGE I.V. OF FLUID - FEEDING INTO EDWARD’S CATHETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Thomas begins to unpack a stack of aluminum containers from Il Mulino. Spoons the contents onto a large plate.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Okay, we got prosciutto de Parma, some fresh mozzarell’, and Bruno threw in some of that fried artichoke crap you froth over.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Guidea. And the meat?

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Double veal chop with lobster truffle oil risotto.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: You sure you want to eat all that? He’s watching them through thin eyes as he works his way through his own I.V.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I'm a bottomless pit. It’s true, I could eat twice this much if some people weren’t such goddamn nursema-- He’s cut off as Thomas clears his throat loudly.  23.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What? (to Carter; off Thomas’ look) Oh. Uh, you want Thomas to make you a plate? Tommy, fix a plate for mister, uh--

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Carter.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Pass.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Yeah? It’s the best in New York.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Good enough to taste it twice? Thomas puts the plate in front of Edward who picks up a piece of fried artichoke...

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You know what they say, living well is the best revenge.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Revenge for what? Edward pops the artichoke in his mouth, grinning as he chews.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Whadd’ya got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As his sumptuous dinner hits the floor with the force of a hurricane. He’s moaning and spitting as he climbs out of bed and makes for the bathroom but his I.V. tubes jerk him back and he ends up on the floor where he unleashes another torrent. After a moment, he looks up to see Carter watching him evenly.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I feel like I’m dying.  24.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: You are. Winces as Edward vomits again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward is in bed and covered in sweat as he shivers uncontrollably. His eyebrows are gone and the first chemo burn blooms above his right eye. Carter is curled up in his own bed as he turns the last page of Vladimir Ilyich Lenin: A Poem by Mayakovsky then places it atop a stack of completed books on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter stares up at the collage of photos and cards taped to the wall above his head. He removes a photograph of his daughter's soccer team. He’s seen standing proudly in the back row wearing a coach’s hat and a whistle around his neck. Edward groans in his sleep and wrestles with his sheets. The bandages have been removed from his head, which is now scarred and littered with uneven patches of stubble. Carter looks over at him until he settles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A new stack of books relating to The Civil War towers atop Carter’s bedside table as Nurse Shing removes an empty I.V. bottle from the stand.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: So, that’s the end of it?

dialogues.speaker: NURSE SHING
dialogues.text: Fourth and final round. Couple more tests and we’ll see where we stand.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: How long?  25.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE SHING
dialogues.text: Soon as I can get Dr. Gibian to look at them. I’m on for another hour. Anything you need.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Thanks Phyllis. She heads out as he checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mind if I turn this on? Edward is sitting up in bed, haggard but lucid as he types angrily on his laptop, sipping a cup of coffee. He waves his hand dismissively. Carter turns the television on to Jeopardy and becomes immediately engrossed...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What is The Great Divide?... What is somnambulism?... Who was Warren Harding?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward pauses in his typing. Glances over at Carter...

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Do you ever miss one?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (shrugs modestly) I missed one last week. Edward studies him for a moment before turning back to his computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward kneels on the floor, head resting on the toilet seat, fast asleep. He’s woken by VOICES coming from the room. He weakly pushes open the door to see who it is.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: ++.-got the corner kick which Karen put right in the box and Angela headed it straight into the net.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel sits on Carter’s bed. He’s elated at the news.  26.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: So who you playing in the championships?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (glumly) Essex.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I’‘ll have to do some homework on ‘em. Edward shuffles out of the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Sorry. He’s a mess as he slowly makes his way around the bed as Virginia walks in from the hallway...

dialogues.speaker: VIRGINIA
dialogues.text: Three months I’m gone and this place has gone to the dogs. There isn’t an M.D. within-- Almost walks into Edward...

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Excuse me. -..as he shuffles over to his bed and wrestles with the cables and tubes. She watches him for a moment then, despite herself, moves to help him.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGINIA
dialogues.text: Nice and easy. She clears a path then helps him ease into bed.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGINIA
dialogues.text: Mmmm.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Mmmm. Don’t you people use words anymore?  27.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGINIA
dialogues.text: You people?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Nurses. I meant-- Forget it.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGINIA
dialogues.text: (walking away) Forget yourself.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I beg your pardon.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGINIA
dialogues.text: You can beg all you want, you ain't gettin’ it.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: How dare you talk to me that way.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGINIA
dialogues.text: I will talk to-- I don’t work for you anymore “Mister Cole” so don’t think for a hummingbird heartbeat you put the quake in my boots with your fat voice because all you're doing is taking up oxygen.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: ‘Gin-

dialogues.speaker: VIRGINIA
dialogues.text: I don’t think so. (back to Edward) It's been two days since a doctor's looked in on my husband and you of all people have the nerve to condescend to us... I’ve been a nurse my entire adult life with a ringside seat to more human tragedy than any woman should have to bear and I’ve learned that the one thing in this world worse than dying is staring your life’s end in the face with no one beside you but a nurse you’ve known for a week who’s being paid to hold your hand... I don’t wish that on you, Mr. Cole, I wouldn’t wish it on anyone, but I know what I know about these things, and you might want to make what ever peace you can with god and give back just a little bit of the respect you so desperately demand, because as far as I can tell, you are going to die alone.  28. Edward's eyes betray him for a brief moment, just enough for her to see she’s laid him wide open. Her regret is immediate. She turns to see everyone staring at her including Thomas who has just entered from the hallway carrying several Chinese take out bags.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Peking Duck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The copper coffee maker reflects a single light source in the otherwise darkened room. Edward stares at the machine from his bed, eyes lost in the gleaming metal. The reflection shifts and Edward rolls over to see Carter adjusting his reading light.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: What are you reading?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Book on Robert Smalls.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Never heard of him.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: He was a conscripted slave aboard a Confederate steamship, The Planter. One night he and some of the crew smuggled their families aboard and stole it right out from under the rebels’ noses. He turned it over to the Union Navy who made him a captain. By the end of the war he’d risen to the rank of General and later became the second African-American to serve in Congress.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Quite a life.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (agreeing) Quite a life.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I don’t like books.  29.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: You're joking.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I never saw the point. History’s just... history. I'd rather make it than read about it.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: How’s that coming along? Make any yet?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I've done alright for myself.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (dubious ) All your dreams fulfilled?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Pretty much, yes. What about you?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Not exactly. We were practically kids ourselves when my first boy came alone. Young, broke and black, you take the first job they offer you. Thirty years goes by in a heartbeat.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Would you change it?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I love my children, if that’s what you mean.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I’m sure you do. But you’re a smart guy, must have had a plan for your life before they came along. Carter thinks a moment, then reaches into the drawer of his bedside table and removes his well-worn wallet. He pulls a small square of yellowed paper out from a pocket and unfolds it gently in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I made this in high school. Creative writing class. Some kind of exercise to get us to think about something besides chasing skirts. He slips out of bed and hands it across to Edward.  30.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (reading) “Carter's Bucket List”... You weren't much on penmanship.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Hasn’t improved, I assure you.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I don’t understand what this is.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I was trying to be funny, I guess. It’s a list of things to do before I kick the bucket.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (still reading) “Make a million dollars. Run for president.”

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I didn’t say it was realistic.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: “Help a complete stranger for the good?” How philanthropic.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (shrugs ) I was sixteen.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: What’s the one about the mountain? Hands the list back.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (without looking) “Listen to the mountain and be heard.” That’s from my uncle. Second World War his squadron flew supplies through the Himalayas into China. Called them the Hump Pilots... Most non-combat casualties of any unit in Air Force history... You can honestly say you’ve accomplished everything you ever dreamed about?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (shrugs ) I’m a millionaire a dozen times over. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I grew my company from the ground up, built my own house, sold it, built a bigger house.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Money ain’t everything.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: No, but it sure takes the edge off being miserable all the time.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: What about your wife?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Which one? We’re talking about dreams, not nightmares.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: There’s got to be something you haven’t done.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Dreams are for teenagers. Let’s face it, we've had our time and we did what we did with it. We’re all out of wishes. The genies left our magic lamps a long time ago.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Suit yourself. He gets back into bed and slips the list between the pages of his book. Edward watches him for a moment, then turns back to staring at the coffee maker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter hides behind the sports section of a local newspaper, highlighting pieces of an article on the Essex girls soccer team.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Come on you pansies, it’s one out, how hard can it be?  32. Carter lowers the paper just enough to reveal Edward lying on his stomach with his head propped on a pillow at the foot of the bed, stretching his tubes and cables to the limit as he yells at the Yankee game on the TV. A Red Sox player bloops a single. Edward is beside himself.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's just... That’s... I can’t take much more of this! Carter's feelings are commensurate as he puts on a pair of head phones and listens to Mozart’s Requiem Lacrymosa. He finishes the article and reaches down for a second newspaper when he sees Holcomb standing at the foot of Edward's bed. Holcomb’s face is pinched and somber as he speaks... Edward listens implacably, his face impossible to read. Carter slides the headphones off to listen...

dialogues.speaker: DR. HOLCOMB
dialogues.text: We're not giving up. There are some experimental programs we’re conducting and I think you'd be an excellent--

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Doc.

dialogues.speaker: DR. HOLCOMB
dialogues.text: --candidate. It’s cutting edge medicine. The odds are against you, but-

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Doctor Holcomb.

dialogues.speaker: DR. HOLCOMB
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You're blocking my view.

dialogues.speaker: DR. HOLCOMB
dialogues.text: Oh. Sorry. Holcomb steps to the side of the television. Stares for a beat... DR. HOLCOMB (CONT’D) Well, if you have any questions.  33. Waits another beat then starts for the door.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (eyes never leaving the screen) One question.

dialogues.speaker: DR. HOLCOMB
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Carter?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: ‘Something you needed from Dr. Holcomb?

dialogues.speaker: DR. HOLCOMB
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I’m not Mister Carter’s--

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You are now. Holcomb stares at him but Edward’s attention never leaves the screen. Finally, Holcomb lifts Carter's chart from the foot of the bed and flips through several pages. After several moments, his shoulders drop and he looks up at Carter and shakes his head slowly.

dialogues.speaker: DR. HOLCOMB
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Mister Carter. According to this your markers haven't stabilized. Carter takes it in, though it’s the answer he expected.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: How long?

dialogues.speaker: DR. HOLCOMB
dialogues.text: Several months. A year if you’re lucky. As I was just telling Edward, we have an experimental program which has had some very positive--

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Sure, Doc. Whatever you think.

dialogues.speaker: DR. HOLCOMB
dialogues.text: I’m truly sorry.  34. Carter just nods and replaces the headphones over his ears as Holcomb makes his exit.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: There was a survey once, a hundred people were asked, if they could, would they want to know in advance the day of their death. Out of the hundred, ninety-six of them said no. Carter closes his eyes as the music washes over him. CARTER (V.O.) (CONT’D) I never understood that. I always thought it would be liberating, knowing exactly how much time you had left to work with. A tear escapes onto his cheek and he looks over at Edward who is staring back at him over his shoulder. CARTER (V.O.) (CONT’D) So now I knew. Neither says a word and Edward finally turns back to the game. FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON CARTER; fast asleep. A square of sunlight moves across his eyes until he opens them and squints into the white light. He rolls over, away from the window and face to-face with a single sheet of yellowed paper propped up against his tower of books. He pulls the paper close to his eyes and sees the title: “EDWARD'S BUCKET LIST.”

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I‘ll be damned. Just as Edward bustles out of the bathroom, arms filled with toiletries.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Thought you'd never get up.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: ‘Time is it? Edward dumps the toiletries in his half-packed suitcase.  35.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Six twenty-four. I’ve been up since-- I’ve had a lot on my mind.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (re: the paper) So I see.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Not bad, huh?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (reading) A hot dog eating contest? “Kiss the most beautiful woman in the world?” How you figure on doing that?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: That’s one of the tough ones. We’1l figure it out.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Don’t take this the wrong way, but these are a little...shallow?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You're out of your mind, there’s some great stuff on there. What kind of tattoo do you think I should get?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: None, actually... I think you misunderstood-

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: No, I understood you perfectly. Your whole unfulfilled dreams thing is great for someone with a few decades in front of him, but I’m looking at weeks, months if I’m lucky. (as Thomas enters, bewildered) About time. Thomas turns and walks out. Edward goes after him, pushes him back into the room.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Pack it up, Tommy. We’re blowing this popsicle stand. (to Carter) (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Your list was a little unrealistic so I took the liberty of paring it down a little. Turns the paper over revealing Carter’s original list which now has several of the items crossed off in red ink - “Run for President”, etc.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: What did you-- You had no right--

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I got them both down to ten a piece so if we budget our time properly we should be able to bang ‘em all out before one of us kicks it.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: (with an armful of business suits) Did you want these arranged by color as usual or--

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Forget ‘em. I’m only about comfort from here on out. I dunno, give ‘em to some orphans or something.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Orphans? You’ve been mixing medications again.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: You don’t seriously think-- I was being metaphorical, you know, taking stock, trying to understand something about--

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Blah, blah, blah. Metaphors are for tea- drinkers who read poetry out loud to their sister. You said yourself you haven't done anything. This is your last chance.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: To make a fool of myself?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: To have your own life. To spend what time you have left remembering what it feels like to have a future, rather than wallowing in the past as a guinea pig in Holcomb’s bullshit science experiment.  37. Carter stares at the floor, his mind racing...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: You think it’s bullshit?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You know it is... What do you think, Tommy. You're in our shoes, what would you do? Carter looks up at Thomas who thinks for a moment...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: I think it’s the dumbest idea I’ve ever heard...and you're fools if you don’t do it. Carter stares at him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty save for a slow-moving nurse or two until Edward bursts out of the room with a full head of steam followed by Thomas, once again laden with luggage, and Carter who carries a small bag and an armful of books. Edward makes for the elevators as Carter struggles to catch up to him.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: What about my family?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: What about them?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I can’t just abandon them.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Why, because you’ve been doing such a great job supporting them from the cancer ward?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: No, I just--

dialogues.speaker: HALL NURSE
dialogues.text: (rushing to stop them) Excuse me? Excuse me! Where do you think you’re going?  38.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (not breaking stride) We're checkin’ out. Tell Holcomb he can take his experimental program and shove it where the sun don’t shine. Nurse Shing comes out of the Nurses Station.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE SHING
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Mister Cole, we can’t let you leave without--

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Without a doctor’s written authorization. Also my rule.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE SHING
dialogues.text: Then you’ll understand my need to enforce it.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Certainly. In fact, Tommy here’s got a doctorate in... What the hell’s it in again?

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Education.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Education, fantastic! (to Thomas) Really, education? What the hell you doing working for me again?

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: If I had a nickel for--

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Anyway, Nurse Phyllis. Seeing as section fourteen, paragraph three of Cole Medical’s operations guidelines fails to stipulate the kind of practitioner necessary to facilitate a release, Doctor Tommy promises to return with a note granting us our freedom post haste. She stops at the elevator door as the other three pack inside.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (taking Carter's books) You won't be needing those.  39.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (to Nurse Shing) Tell my wife-- He’s cut off as the doors close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward helps Thomas load the luggage into the trunk of the waiting limousine.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: It’s not like we’re flying off around the world, at least not at first. I figure we knock out the ones we can do locally before heading over to Europe, then Africa and--

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I can’t go to Africa.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Why not? I thought all black people dream of going back to the homeland.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: It’s not that. It’s-- I’ve never been on an airplane.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (climbing inside the limo) You're joking me.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (stopping at the door) No. I’m not.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You should've put that on the list. He pulls Carter inside and the door closes.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And so it began... As the big limo roars away, the sound of which becomes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward is electrified with nervous energy while Carter looks like he'd rather be anywhere else.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Okay, so I figure middle of three then we go. You ready?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Good. He, along with everyone else around them, looks off in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I want to go back... I’m serious, have your man-- Where is he? (looking around) Have him take me back to the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Forget it.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (grabbing him) No you forget it. This isn’t rational.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Of course it’s not rational, that’s why it’s so exciting. (the crowd groans) That’s our cue. You ready?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: No! Edward starts unbuttoning his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Yankee outfielders jog out to their positions. The crowd suddenly ROARS as the left fielder passes a naked man who is jogging and waving across the grass. Carter holds Edward's clothes, staring in disbelief as Edward takes a victory lap towards right field.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Oh lord.  41. Stadium security guards hustle out after Edward, forcing him to veer towards deep center field. The crowd boos, as it appears they have him trapped, until he throws a fake on one of his pursuers who trips in the grass much to the crowd's delight. Edward's headed back into left but the NYPD has joined the chase and they’re closing in fast. Edward tries another fake, but he’s tackled by a burly police officer who brings him to the ground. A second officer helps bring Edward’s arms behind his back when something suddenly knocks him off his feet and into his fellow officer. INT. CARTER’S HOUSE - NIGHT Rachel does her homework while Roger studies for the L- SATS. The ball game is turned down low on the television. Rachel is stuck on a particularly heinous geometry equation when her brother starts smacking her arm.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Ow! What’d you do that for?

dialogues.speaker: ROGER
dialogues.text: Look! He turns the volume up on the television where Carter is seen streaking away from the fallen policemen, clutching his genitals with a look of incredulous fear on his face. Brother and sister share a look before-

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL ROGER
dialogues.text: Mom! Mom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward streaks after Carter, whooping and hollering. Carter is actually beginning to enjoy himself until he pulls up short. Edward comes to a stop next to him.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Oh crap. They turn and run for the stands followed closely by SEVERAL DOZEN security and police officers

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Virginia walks up to the sergeant’s desk.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGINIA
dialogues.text: I’m here to post bail for my husband. The NIGHT SERGEANT barely looks up from his paperwork as he hands her a clipboard.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Down the hall, second door on the right. Sign here. She is less than pleased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Virginia counts out several hundred-dollar bills then hands them to waiting BOOKING OFFICER.

dialogues.speaker: BOOKING OFFICER
dialogues.text: And if you could sign here, that should do it. Again, Virginia signs her name where instructed as the officer speaks into a microphone. BOOKING OFFICER (CONT’D) Release for Chambers, number three. (to Virginia) It'll be just a second. Virginia walks to a chair across the room from where Edward waits dressed in prison pajamas and Thomas’ overcoat.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: For the record it was my fault. I talked him into it.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGINIA
dialogues.text: He’s not a grown man?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Even so, I'd like to pay you back for the bail, if--

dialogues.speaker: VIRGINIA
dialogues.text: That’s not necessary.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Really, it’s the least I can--  43.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGINIA
dialogues.text: You've done quite enough, Mister Cole. Carter spent thirty years killing himself with those cigarettes. If the lord sees fit to give him a second chance I'd like it to be home with his family where he belongs, not in prison, and certainly not with you.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: He hasn’t told you. The door to the holding cell opens with a CLANG as Carter is ushered out by a guard. He’s dressed in prison pajamas and clings to a blanket as he shivers uncontrollably.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGINIA
dialogues.text: (to Carter) Told me what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Virginia wipes tears from her face as she walks resolutely to her car. Carter follows her, watching Edward as Thomas helps him to the limo.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGINIA
dialogues.text: I'm taking you back to the hospital. See about getting you into Dr. Holcomb’s--

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I can't. She opens the driver’s side door. Carter stops on the passenger's side.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGINIA
dialogues.text: Don’t play with me.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Gin’, you don’t understand. He sees Edward waiting at the limo door, watching Carter.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGINIA
dialogues.text: (sees Edward watching) I understand plenty. You two think you can run off and act like children because your time’s up so nothing matters anymore. Why don’t you tell your children that? See what they have to say when they find out you've given up on them.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Given up?! I’ve spent my life giving up everything to this family. Thirty years greased up under the hood of a car to see that they didn’t want for nothing! And they didn’t, ‘Gin... I gave up every last one of my ambitions and I wouldn’t take any of it back, but if I am gonna die, I'd like to go out with some idea of who I could have been...of who I am.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGINIA
dialogues.text: You’re my husband.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I know it. I just wish I knew what that meant anymore... He turns and walks over to the limo. He takes a last look at his incredulous wife then climbs inside.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: CARTER’S POV - CENTRAL NEW JERSEY SEEN FROM 8,000 FEET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see him through one of the windows. Feeling queasy, he shuts the blind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON CARTER; wearing a helmet and struggling with the top of a child-proof prescription pill bottle.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Need a hand?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: No, I got it... (to no avail) Dammit! Throws the bottle to the floor. It rolls towards the cockpit where Edward is seen from the back, talking with the pilots.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (about all of it) Fool... So foolish...

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Wanna try to get it?  45. PULL BACK to reveal KYLE, young and brawny, sitting immediately behind Carter. In fact, Carter is literally sitting in Kyle’s lap.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: How do you suggest we do that? Kyle stands suddenly - he’s huge, about 6’5” and Carter is bound to his torso via a series of nylon jump straps. As his feet dangle, Carter pitches forward until his upper-body is almost horizontal while his hips are still vertically strapped to Kyle. Kyle duck-walks the suspended Carter over to the prescription bottle. Carter extends his arms down but the bottle rolls out of his grasp and into Edward’s outstretched hand. Carter looks up at him. Edward appears as if he hasn’t touched a razor in days.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Not a word. (grabs the bottle) Back to the chair, Kyle. Kyle waddles back to the chair. Carter almost hits his head on the fuselage.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (to Kyle) You'll have to forgive him, Kyle. He’s on the outs with the wife.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: (sympathetic hand on Carter’s knee) Been there, man.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Some things are not up for discussion.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I understand. The CO-PILOT comes out and straps himself to Edward's back.

dialogues.speaker: CO-PILOT
dialogues.text: Thirty seconds to drop.  46.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (to Carter) She’s tough, your wife. That’s good. The Sequel was tough like that.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: The Sequel?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: The second Mrs. Edward Cole. God that woman hated me.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) I can’t imagine why.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Maybe because he called her The Sequel.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Thank you, Kyle.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Know what I learned? That independence is the only true gauge of human virtue; what a man is and what he makes of himself. Not what he has or hasn’t done for others. As the Co-Pilot pulls the door open, filling the cabin with whipping wind. Kyle stands and moves them closer to the door. Carter eyes the abyss outside. Edward is nonplussed.

dialogues.speaker: CO-PILOT
dialogues.text: Fifteen seconds. Fourteen. Thirteen.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (to Carter) There's no substitute for personal dignity.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (terrified) Could you shut up?!

dialogues.speaker: CO-PILOT
dialogues.text: Ten. Nine. Eight. Kyle lowers goggles over Carter’s face.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I can’t do this.  47.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Sure you can.

dialogues.speaker: CO-PILOT
dialogues.text: Five. Four. Three.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I can’t do this! He screams as Kyle jumps and they disappear out the door. Edward watches them fall away then dons his goggles...

dialogues.speaker: CO-PILOT
dialogues.text: Here we go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they leap from the plane, free-falling into the ether. Everything goes quiet save for the flapping of their jump suits. The Co-Pilot dives towards Kyle and Carter, whose scream grows louder as they approach, and lock hands so that Carter and Edward are once again face to face.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: This is amazing! Carter’s too busy being terrified to respond.

dialogues.speaker: CO-PILOT
dialogues.text: Cords in five seconds. He and Kyle separate, getting distance between them...

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: You wanna do it?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Just let ‘er rip! Carter is unsure which cord is which, so he pulls everything. He’s jerked to a stop as both main and emergency chutes billow open. Edward and the Co-Pilot continue to drop, watching their counterparts’ dueling chutes flapping high above.  48.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Amazing. Nine toes in the grave he’s still afraid to let go.

dialogues.speaker: CO-PILOT
dialogues.text: Okay, let’s deploy.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Right there’s the piss of it. When you’re living for someone else you can’t help but be careful... No progress in careful.

dialogues.speaker: CO-PILOT
dialogues.text: We're in the red zone.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I was in love once.

dialogues.speaker: CO-PILOT
dialogues.text: Pull the damn cord! But Edward just closes his eyes, spreads his arms out, and lets god decide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The furious, muffled swearing of the Co-pilot is heard from within the building as Edward and Carter walk towards the limo. Edward has taken out The Bucket List. With the red pen he crosses off “Jump out of a perfectly good airplane” just below “Streak Yankee Stadium,” both on his side of the list.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Two down. Eighteen in the pipe. How you feeling?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (horrible) Terrific.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (oblivious) Me too. Who'd believe that only yesterday we were rotting in a cancer ward?  49.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Back in one piece I see. How fortunate.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: We live to die another day. (to Carter) I’m hungry. Are you hungry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the annual Nathans Famous Hot Dog Eating Contest. Participants and onlookers mill beneath a striped tent. Edward wears a contestant’s badge. Carter watches as Thomas massages Edward’s shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I’m telling you, I got it in the bag.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: You're a bottomless pit.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Goddamn right I am. (to Carter) ‘Sure you don’t want in?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I’m quite sure I’m out of my league on this one.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Suit yourself. Hey, when I’m done here, we'll go to that Russian place. Get some of that caviar you were talking about.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: We'll see. A whistle sounds and Edward joins the other contestants behind a dozen long tables laid out end to end. Before each contestant is a tray of dozens of hot dogs in buns. Edward looks over at the tiny FEMALE KOREAN CONTESTANT standing next to him. Tries to stare her down. Carter and Thomas watch from the crowd..

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Your boss, he’s not all there, is he?  50.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: His relationship with sanity has its little hiccups... Still, you gotta admire his pluck. Edward continues to stare down the hundred pound Korean woman.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You're going down, sister. The whistle sounds and the contestants dive in.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. WINNER’S PODIUM - DAY Where the tiny Korean woman raises her arms in victory as a judge drapes a medal over her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward lags behind Carter and Thomas as they head back to the car. Edward is griping over the outcome...

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: And what is this dipping the buns in water crap. If you’re going to eat it, eat it... Screw this, I’m going back. Turns back towards the tent then stops cold.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: What’s the problem?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I don’t feel so good.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: So that’s a no on the caviar?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Go fuck yourself, Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Trying my best sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He and Carter are staring at a wall of tacky tattoo art.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I don’t know. The skull is kind of cool but maybe I’m more of a Confederate flag kind of guy.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I didn’t know you were from the south.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Connecticut actually. Our side won, I can wear any flag I want. What’re you going to get?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (not into it) I can’t think of anything meaningful.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: What’s meaningful? We’re gonna be dead in five minutes. The heavily inked TATTOO ARTIST looks up at them from behind the counter.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Not literally.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Nah, I think I’m gonna--

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You can’t keep passing on things. We're supposed to be in this together.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Tattoos and hot dogs aren’t exactly what I had in mind.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: So what did you have in mind? Something metaphorical? Something life-changing? Oooh. Ahhh... Lighten up, already. This is supposed to be fun.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Fun is fine. I have no problem with fun, I just imagined there'd be more behind this than pretending we’re nine year- old's again.  52.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Nine year old’s don’t have tattoos.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: That’s a wonderful argument.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (to the Tattoo Artist) Am I right?

dialogues.speaker: TATTOO ARTIST
dialogues.text: My kid’s got three of ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You must be incredibly proud... That’s it! I got it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward winces in pain as the Tattoo Artist inks his shoulder blade. Carter’s reading one of his books.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: So fine, we’ll do a “grown-up” one next.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: That's not the point.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Then what is? He suddenly erupts into a coughing fit.

dialogues.speaker: TATTOO ARTIST
dialogues.text: I can’t do this if you keep moving.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Sorry, I'll tell the cancer to take the day off.

dialogues.speaker: TATTOO ARTIST
dialogues.text: (pulling back) You guys got cancer?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Don't worry, it’s the non-contagious kind... Chop chop, we don’t have much time.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I’m going to call Virginia.  53. The Tattoo Artist grunts in response and plunges the needle into Edward’s back. He grits his teeth, containing the scream. Carter can’t help but smile a little as he dials the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward examines the reflection of his tattoo in the window of a pristine Mustang Shelby GT.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: It's not bad, it’s just... Do I really look that--

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Old? Both are dressed in racing suits.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I was going to say tired. Still, it’s a pretty good likeness. For the first time we see the tattoo - it’s Edward, scowling out from his own shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And you can’t tell me it’s not meaningful.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Not where you’re concerned, no.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (looking at the car) This what you wanted? Carter grins as he nods and pulls on his helmet.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Ready for an ass-whuppin’? Edward replaces the bandage and zips his suit up. His burgeoning facial hair has been shaved into giant Elvis chops.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: We'll see.  54. He walks around the Mustang to the waiting Lamborghini Murcielago Roadster. Nearly one of a kind, it’s more rocket than automobile.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: First one to a hundred miles. Loser buys dinner.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I’m having dinner at home tonight.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Of course you are. Slips into the car, closing the gull-wing door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter climbs into the car. Checks the gauges as he runs his hand along the beautifully refurbished dash.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Now this is more like it.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (filtered) Grown-up enough for you? Carter pulls on his helmet. Adjusts the microphone in front of his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: You sure we’re cleared for this? The Lamborghini comes to life, whining like an aircraft engine.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: It’s taken care of. Why, you want to pass again? Carter turns the ignition on the Mustang. It’s growl is guttural and primal.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: You're in my world now. See you at dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Mustang drenches the Lamborghini in a shower of dirt and rocks as it fishtails out onto the track.  55.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Windshield wipers clear the dirt as Edward struggles to put the car in gear.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: So it’s like that, is it? The gears grind as he works the stick. Finally gets the car in gear as Carter is heard over the headset, cackling for joy. ON THE TRACK; where the Mustang screams around a turn, taking a line close to the infield where the Lamborghini hiccups in fits and starts towards the track. IN THE LAMBORGHINI; Edward wrestles with the stick...

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on, you stupid-- The car jerks forwards onto the tarmac, right in the path of the oncoming... IN THE MUSTANG; Carter hits the gas, taking the car low across the infield, narrowly missing the Lamborghini before he roars back onto the track. Carter grins into his rearview mirror, sees Edward's car swerving across the track behind him. IN THE LAMBORGHINI; Edward’s trying to control the car.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It's a racing set up. Steer with the throttle.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Which one’s the throttle? He’s about to hit the wall until he mashes the gas and the car suddenly launches down the track. DOWN THE TRACK; Edward pulls even with the Mustang.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So we’re having fun now?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: It’s a nod in the right direction. The Mustang jumps ahead, cuts the Lamborghini off.  56.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You know what your problem is?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I’m sure you'll enlighten me. The Lamborghini cuts around and pulls even again.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You're the guy behind the chairs at the poker table.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Come again?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You know, the one who stands there with his hands in his pockets, peering over the players’ shoulders, studying the game like he’s learning something, when all he really wants to do is walk away.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: And live to fight another day. Maybe he’s got a mortgage, and tuition payments, and-

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: So why’s he in the casino in the first place? He’s dying to get in the game. What’s keeping his hands in his pockets?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Not everyone can afford to play.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I’m not talking about money. I don’t think he’s afraid to lose, everybody loses sometimes. But what I think? I think that deep down, you’re afraid to win. Now the Lamborghini takes the lead, clipping the front of the Mustang as it pulls in front.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Jesus! (regains control of the car) Why on earth would anybody be afraid to win?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: That’s between you and your shrink, I just call ‘em where they fall.  57.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: You want to talk about-- You’re the most fearful person I’ve ever known. God forbid you ever open the door a crack and give up even the smallest ounce of control.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: My work done my way. Personal, selfish, egotistical motivation. Look where it’s gotten me.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Alone, bitter and scared of anything with a hint of emotional consequence.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Depravity’s in the eye of the beholder. At least I’m not chicken. IN THE MUSTANG; Carter rolls his eyes, knowing he shouldn't take the bait. He drives evenly for a moment. Then, despite himself...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Ah, screw it. ON THE TRACK; the Mustang revs and roars alongside of the Lamborghini before slamming into its side. The Mustang pulls away then smashes into the car again. Both cars careen off the track, punching through a chain link fence then out into the outer parking lot. LONG SHOT; as the two cars play demolition derby in the empty lot, colliding towards us until they roar past and slam through the striped security gates and out onto the open road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cars speed down either side of the double-yellow line doing well over a hundred as they smash back and forth.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Do you have any idea what these cars cost me?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: We're sitting at the table, aren’t we? SIRENS BLARE as a police car appears behind them.  58.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Are we really?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Are we really what? As the Lamborghini suddenly guns ahead, red-lining down the highway.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He really is crazy. The Mustang roars after it. The police car loses ground quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Thomas emerges followed by Edward and Carter. Thomas carries the police paperwork. Edward's marking up the list.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: That’s a serious fine.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Chump change. My tab. He crosses off “RACE A VINTAGE MUSTANG” on Carter’s list, then flips it over, putting a line through “GET IN A POLICE CHASE” on his side.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Better believe your tab.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You gonna tell the wife about this one?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I’m not the crazy one. EXT. CARTER’S HOUSE - NIGHT A small but comfortable-looking low-income brick face. A couple of street kids stare as the limo pulls up out front.  59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter reaches for the door. Edward is sprawled out across the opposite seat watching the Yankee game.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Sure you two don’t want some roast?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: And face Darth Vader, I’m sure she’d love that. Tommy’s got family to get to and I’ve got six innings left.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Suit yourself. ‘Night Thomas. Thomas waves from the front as Carter climbs out and closes the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Nice of him to ask.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Superlative. Despite his sarcasm, he watches Carter talking to the street kids before climbing the steps to his door.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why aren’t we moving?

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: A thousand pardons, mein fuhrer.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Thomas.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Go fuck myself?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Yahtzee. (to the TV) Oh, come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
