dialogues.text: Floor to ceiling bookshelves. Edward slouches in a large, leather couch. Heaves a sigh of displeasure as he switches off the losing ballgame.  60. He stands and stretches while looking around the room. Unsure of what to do, he stuffs his hands in his pockets and moves to a wall of books, browsing the titles.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Oh, who cares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Immense and unused with glowing hardwood floors and a pristine grand piano covered in empty silver picture frames. He walks in like a stranger, hands still in his pockets and stops just inside the door. He stares for a long moment then turns and walks out. INT. EDWARD’S KITCHEN - NIGHT Edward is on the phone. Holds a take-out menu.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: What do you mean you don’t deliver past six, what kind of business is that?... I don’t care what day it is, you--

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now what? Slams the phone down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward emerges through double stained-glass doors into the marble foyer just as the elevator doors open revealing Carter, Virginia and their kids.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Happy Easter.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (to Carter) What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Loser buys dinner... Grab this, will ya? Lays an enormous platter of mashed potatoes into Edward's arms. The rest of the family doesn’t move.  61.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well, come on. Turkey ain’t gonna carve itself now. The family shuffles out reluctantly. The boys bid Edward hello, but Virginia says nothing. Clearly, she’s been out voted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paneled walls wrapping around an immense mahogany table. Roger and Lee stare open-mouthed at the opulence.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Okay, just let me get a tablecloth or something. Balances the potatoes as he rummages through some drawers he’s probably never opened before.

dialogues.speaker: ROGER
dialogues.text: How many people live here? Edward digs up a load of silverware and woven placemats.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Just me... And don’t touch anything. This stuff costs more than your education.

dialogues.speaker: LEE
dialogues.text: We went to public school.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Oh. The boys are too polite to laugh.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know what, screw it. Just dump it all down there. Drops the potatoes with no small amount of relief.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don’t know about you guys, but I could eat a station wagon. The boys smile openly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HI-TECH RECORD PLAYER; as Edward lays a platter down on the turntable and drops the needle. Louis Armstrong's Autumn in New York plays over the following SERIES: -- IN THE DINING ROOM; Rachel organizes the place settings. Fork and spoon on the left, knife on the right. Opposite her, Edward tries to mirror the layout. Gets it right the second time. -- Carter sits with eyes closed and hands pressed together, saying grace. Edward watches him, eyes flicking around the table to see the rest of the family have their eyes closed. -- JUMP CUTS as Carter hands Edward the carving knife; Edward attacks the meat while the others look on; Virginia watches as her perfect roast is hacked to pieces; a blockish chunk lands on Lee’s plate. -- Edward is a wallflower as the family tucks into the meal, passing steaming dishes back and forth through a lively discussion. -- Edward’s on his second plate. He’s talking now, telling a story that has Virginia mildly on edge. The kids seem to love it, except Rachel who makes eyes at him. Edward returns the look until she points to her closed mouth. He gets the picture and snaps his mouth shut, swallowing his food before continuing. -- Carter stares glumly at the tiny slice of apple pie sitting on his plate. Virginia is marking the size of Edward's slice with a pie cutter. Edward motions for a bigger piece. Virginia moves the cutter. Edward’s still not satisfied. She moves it again. -- IN THE KITCHEN; Edward coaxes a steaming cup of coffee from the copper siphon. He puts it on a saucer and carefully offers it to Virginia who has a chain-gang of dishes going at the sink with Carter and the boys. She allows a thin smile as she moves to accept the coffee, then notices Carter behind Edward, shaking his head not to take it. She looks back at Edward and politely demurs. -- IN THE LIBRARY; Edward waits for the last bars of the song to end before lifting the needle and carefully sliding the record back into it’s sleeve.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGINIA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: They played that at our wedding. She stands in the doorway, wiping her hands on a kitchen towel.  63.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You were married in the city?

dialogues.speaker: VIRGINIA
dialogues.text: First Baptist in the Bronx. My uncle was the pastor so we got the reception room for free. It’s gone now. ‘Put up one of them gargantuan shopping malls.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: They tend to do that these days.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGINIA
dialogues.text: They do. A beat. He’s unsure how to approach her...

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Health care’s a perilous industry. The only way we can keep the hospitals from closing is to reduce the overhead so--

dialogues.speaker: VIRGINIA
dialogues.text: I understand. It’s business.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Not to the people we let go.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGINIA
dialogues.text: Do you find that difficult?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Only when you meet them. Which I try very hard not to do.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGINIA
dialogues.text: I don’t blame you.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: We keep them from closing.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGINIA
dialogues.text: You don’t owe me anything.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Still, I’d like to--

dialogues.speaker: VIRGINIA
dialogues.text: Give him back to me.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I’m not sure I can--  64.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGINIA
dialogues.text: I’m not asking for his sake. He’s the only one who can decide what’s best for him. I’m asking for myself.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I don’t understand.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGINIA
dialogues.text: I’m prepared for him to die. If there’s one thing I understand it’s that, but what I can’t do-- I’m his wife. I’m not prepared to lose him while he’s alive. Her eyes hold his. She’s laid herself wide open and he’s unable to look away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter enters ahead of Edward. He whistles at the sumptuous cabin.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Now this is what I’m talking about.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: It’s the best.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: It'd have to be. How much money do you have, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I’ve got enough. This is just a time- share so--

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: How much is enough?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Didn’t anyone tell you it’s rude to talk about money?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I never knew anyone with enough money to ask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Gulfstream lifts off the runway.  65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter accepts a frozen daiquiri from the STEWARD.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Thank you. (to Edward) I could get used to this. Edward nods. He’s pensive.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Maybe we should go back?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Come again?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I just think you should-- It’s easy for me, but you've got your family to think about, and--

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: ‘Ginia got to you, didn’t she?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: She wants you back. You can’t blame her for--

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Why do you think I’m doing this?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Because I talked you into it.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (shakes his head; a beat) At first, you tell yourself it’s a rut; just part of the ups and downs of marriage. You figure the pendulum will swing back the other way like it always has before and everything will be right again... A year goes by, then another and soon you’ve been sleeping only on your side of the bed so long you forget how to reach across and bring her into your arms. You forget why you could never walk down the sidewalk without holding her hand or what it was about her smile that stirred you. She’s the same girl I fell in love with at seventeen. Nothing's changed, but everything’s different. Then I realized, it’s me. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I lost something along the way and I aim to find it... Sometimes you have to take the long way home. Edward nods slowly.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tell me about the island?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: It’s a few acres. Beach all around. Palm trees. Some kind of a small house, I think.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Completely deserted?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I think so.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: We can’t “live on a deserted island” if it’s not deserted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Completely deserted. Seen from high above as a SEAPLANE lands just outside the reef.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward and Carter walk from the trees out onto the sugary beach surveying the reef and gently lapping waves.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Yeah. They sit in the sand. Carter scoops up a handful and lets it run through his open fingers. He sighs contentedly... Edward sighs as well... Several long, empty moments pass. Carter sighs again. Edward nods in silent agreement. Several more moments pass until...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Think we can still call the plane back?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: God, I hope so.  67. Whips out his satellite phone as they run back towards the trees, brushing the wet sand off their butts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WAITER passes with a tray supporting an enormous bowl of caviar which he deposits in the center of a table where Edward sits with Carter and Rachel. All are dressed for the occasion and Edward now sports a freshly waxed pencil-thin moustache.

dialogues.speaker: WAITER
dialogues.text: Anything else, gentlemen?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Would you look at that?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: It looks disgusting.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (heaping it onto toast) In Iran they call it Aswad Thahab, Black Gold.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: They can call it whatever they want, still looks nasty. She takes a tiny spoonful and sniffs at it. Edward is studying the Bucket List.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Some of this is just so... “Laugh until you cry?” How you figure on that?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Got any good jokes?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: That’s Tommy’s department. What about number seven?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: What’s seven?  68.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Being a contestant on Jeopardy? Carter takes his first bite, closes his eyes and savors the flavor. Rachel eyes him carefully, still not convinced.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (to Edward) Like most people, I guess. Take some kind of test and then--

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You realize that could take months. What if you can’t--? Forget it. You figure that one out. (to Rachel) How’s the caviar?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (making a face) Honestly?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (looks at Carter who nods) It tastes like ass. Edward almost chokes on his food. Soon all three are laughing.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Couldn’t have said it better myself.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: More for me then.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (still laughing) She sounded just like Emily.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Who’s Emily?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: My little-- Well, she’s not so little anymore, she’s--

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: You have a daughter?  69. His grave surprise brings the laughter to a halt. Edward’s suddenly uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Yeah...had a daughter...we don’t--

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Why on earth not?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (pause) Carl Okafor.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: What’s a carlo-kafor?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I'd really rather--

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: When was the last time you saw her?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Dad.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Answer me. Edward just shakes his head. Carter grabs the list and the pen and adds “#11” to the bottom of Edward’s ten tasks.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (writing) Get back in touch--

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (slamming his hand down) Stop it!

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Because “some things are not up for discussion.”

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Not this. This is too important.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You don’t know me.  70.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I don’t have to. I know when something's more important than flinging yourself off an airplane or running around with cattle... (looks at Rachel) She’s your-- Some things are more important... I’1l be right back. Takes a last bite of caviar and heads to the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: He’s not the most tractable man, your father.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: He’s just... He calls me “The Accident.” They weren’t planning on having more kids. Also because when I was eight, I chased my ball into the street when a car came. It dragged me the whole block before it stopped. I was in the hospital for a month. The first night, he told me he'd give anything if god would let him switch places with me.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: That’s how it should be.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Can I ask you something?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Is she pretty? Edward takes a beat, then nods slowly. There’s a sudden commotion and the waiter quick-walks over to them.

dialogues.speaker: WAITER
dialogues.text: Right this way please.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: What’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Where’s dad?

dialogues.speaker: WAITER
dialogues.text: There’s been an-- If you please!  71.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (to Rachel) Stay here. INT. PETROSSIAN MEN’S ROOM- NIGHT Edward bursts in. It’s empty. Sees blood pooling across the sinks.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Carter?!

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I was trying to wash it off. He’s sprawled out underneath the sinks. Edward rushes to him and pulls him out.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's my only suit. It’s covered in blood, running from his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Daddy! She’s standing in the open doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Edward and the waiter help Carter through the dining room.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Hold on. I need to...just for a second. They stop by the ice sculpture allowing Carter to lean on the table. Edward notices everyone staring at the blood on Carter’s suit, whispering to each other, doing little to hide their distaste.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (to a gawking woman) Can I help you? You’ve never seen a dying man before? (to the room) Get a good look, because someday this will be each and every one of you.  72.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (weakly) Edward. Edward loops his head under Carter’s arm and resumes their way towards the door.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (to the room) You're fucking parasites!

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: INT. CARTER’S BEDROOM - DAY Carter sits up against the headboard looking surprisingly fit. Rachel sits on the edge of the bed dressed in her soccer uniform.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: ...-draw their fullbacks to the ball leaving the left side open for you to slip behind them as long as you watch the off-sides.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: You really think they'll fall for it?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Worked against Brazil last year. Just enjoy yourself. Win or lose, that’s the most important thing.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (at the door) Don’t believe a word of it, kid. If winning isn’t everything, why do they keep score?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Good point. (kissing Rachel) Good luck, baby. She jogs out, her cleats clacking on the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I hear you’re doing well.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: It was just an ulcer. It’s spread to my stomach so-- It’s expected.  73.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: And why aren't you going to the game?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Holcomb said I should rest. I’m not supposed to get excited.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: So don’t get excited.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: You've never seen me coach.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: So don’t coach. Carter thinks about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The game is well underway as Edward and Carter skulk behind the back row of onlookers on the field.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Why don’t we stand where we can actually see the field?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: ‘Ginia’s here. I don’t want her to--

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Too late. Points up to the bleachers where Virginia stares down at them. Shakes her head angrily and turns back to the game.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Gotta get me a bigger dog house. May as well go up front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s late in the second half and the mid-field scorer’s table shows zero-zero. Carter and Edward stand right next to it.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (shouting) Pass it, pass it, pass the...oh come on ref! That’s a penalty! As the Essex team steals the ball and drives it up field.  74.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You're not supposed to get excited.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I’m exhilarated. There’s a difference.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (pause) So this may not be the best time, but...I’m heading out of town tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (half-listening) Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Spain first.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: The festival's coming up and--

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Which festival? As Rachel steals the ball and passes to a teammate.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (shouting) That’s what I’m talking about!

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Pamplona.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Which one’s that? Nice pass!

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: The one with all the cattle. Carter turns to look at him. Realizes Edward is talking about finishing the list without him. He stares for several moments before a surge in the crowd pulls him back to the game. Four side side. of Rachel's teammates are streaking up the right of the field while Rachel quietly jogs up the left

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: They’re drawing the fullbacks.  75.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, it’s just that--

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Shut up for a second. Rachel turns on the speed and streaks into enemy territory.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She’s open. She’s open. She’s-- As the ball loops over the fullbacks’ heads towards the goal. Rachel controls it then shoots...just out of the goalie’s reach and into the net. The crowd goes ballistic. None more than Carter who leaps into the air, screaming his head off...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now I’m excited! The scorer sounds an air horn and the game is over. The players converge on Rachel, tackling her in mid-field. Carter looks up at Virginia who is hopping like mad in the bleachers. They share a look. He’s out of the dog house for the moment.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Edward) Taking that macked-out plane of yours?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Commercial.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Business class?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Hope you got another ticket then, ‘cause-- Stops as he sees Edward holding up a pair of first class plane tickets. Carter smiles.  76. Suddenly he’s hit from behind by a flood of ponytails. Joined by their current coach, the entire team surrounds him as they hop up and down with glee. He lifts Rachel off the ground and hugs her for all he’s worth.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. CARTER’S BEDROOM - NIGHT Carter deposits a litany of pill bottles into his shabbily packed suitcase which lies open on the bed. Roger comes in with Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Need any help?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Thanks, baby. I’m just about there.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (eying the suitcase) Nuh-uh. She pulls his clothes out and starts re-folding them. He smiles and removes the pills, placing them into a bag.

dialogues.speaker: ROGER
dialogues.text: When are you coming back?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: ‘Bout a month, I guess. It’s an open ticket so-- You take care of your mother for me.

dialogues.speaker: ROGER
dialogues.text: What do you think I’ve been doing?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I guess you’ve been the man of the house for a while now. I’m so proud of you son.

dialogues.speaker: ROGER
dialogues.text: Sorry I can’t say the same.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (pause) I understand.

dialogues.speaker: ROGER
dialogues.text: Man, please. You don’t understand nothing! You’re running off with your sugar-daddy fat cat to-  77.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Don‘t ever use that tone with me, boy! (a beat; he’s never raised his voice like this) I know you can’t understand why I have to do this...but I do. I have to do it and I'm begging you to respect that. I’ve never asked anything of you son, and if you tell me that it won’t be okay and you won't be able to watch over them for me...then I’ll stay and we’ll never talk about it again. He hands Roger the bag of pills. Roger is unsure what to do. He looks at Rachel who nods slowly. Roger bows his head and wipes his eyes...then he holds the bag out to his father.

dialogues.speaker: ROGER
dialogues.text: Just don’t die on us.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Not this trip. He ignores the bag and wraps his arms around his son.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I love you, son. I love you so much. Rachel finishes folding his shirt and lays it gently into the suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. CARTER’S HOUSE - DAY As Thomas puts the suitcase into the limo. He closes the trunk revealing Carter who is kissing his children goodbye. Carter looks up at the front door of the house, but Virginia is not there. He blows his daughter a final kiss then climbs inside. Edward now has a goatee and a freshly shaved Mohawk which reveals several lesions on his scalp. He moves to follow Carter but stops as he sees Virginia watching from a window.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I‘1l bring him home.  78.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pulling away. Carter watches through the back window as his children see him go.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You okay? Carter nods as he sits back down in the seat.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: And I thought cancer was hard... Man, what the hell is that thing on your head?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seen through a stone doorway as hundreds of people stream past, running for their lives from the herd of bulls charging hard on their heels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Running with the crowd now as dozens pass until we find Edward and Carter whooping and hollering in the heart of the push. They’re having the time of their lives until Edward trips and falls. Carter turns back for him just as he sees the bulls roiling towards them.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: You okay? The bulls are closing fast.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Give me your hands!

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I got it. I-- As Carter yanks him up, throwing them into the base of the wall an instant before the bulls thunder past...

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That was close.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Yeah. You were a goner for sure. Edward stands and tests his legs.  79.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: My knee’s a little--

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Come on. Loops Edward's arm around his neck and the two shuffle off after the departed bulls.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: For the record, I’m on my way out anyway, so don’t get all puffed up about saving my life.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Hey, Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Do me a favor. Once we get to the hotel, and you're back, all comfortable in the room, take a second and go fuck yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Carter sits at the end of a long table. His eyes are wide as he stares in dumb wonder. The CAMERA TRACKS down the table to reveal his dinner companions: PAUL MCCARTNEY, MOHAMMAD ALI, LUCIANO PAVAROTTI, and ELIZABETH TAYLOR all engaged in a lively discussion. Edward sits at the far end, chatting with PRINCE WILLIAM. He shares a look with Carter who is unable to organize himself until a mechanical voice interrupts--

dialogues.speaker: MECHANICAL VOICE
dialogues.text: Please pass the salt. Carter grabs the salt and passes it to STEVEN HAWKING who sits on his right in his wheelchair. Hawking’s wife JANE WILDE smiles as she salts her husband’s shepherd's pie. MECHANICAL VOICE (CONT’D) Thank you. Carter can only nod and smile.  80.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter closes the door to Mohammad Ali’s car then steps back on the curb next to Edward. Both are still starstruck.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Well, that was...

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: One question?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: How much that one cost you?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You really don’t want to know. Carter nods as they start walking down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bathed red in the first ray of the morning sun. Edward and Carter sit atop an ancient wall, taking in the endless expanse of desert below, though Carter’s eyes are closed. Edward has the list out. Crosses off “See the Pyramids.”

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You know technically, we can kill two of these.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (eyes still closed) Listening.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: To what? (Carter doesn’t answer) (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Anyway, I figure you want to “Witness something Majestic,” this is about as good as it gets.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: You haven't seen the mountain yet.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (shrugs ) Never will if we sit around here all day. Starts to get up...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: The ancient Egyptians had a beautiful belief about death... When their souls reached the entrance to heaven, the gods would ask them two questions. Their answers determined if they were admitted or not.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: What were they?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Have you found joy in your life? Edward realizes that Carter has opened his eyes and is looking directly at him.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: What, you’re asking? Oh, how the hell do

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: It’s a simple question. Have you found joy in your life?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (thinks for several moments) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Next question. Edward’s uncomfortable with whatever he remembered.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Has your life brought joy to others?  82.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (standing) This is horseshit.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Is it?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Haven’t I done enough for you? (getting agitated) I set everything up myself. Paid for the cars, the plane tickets. It took me a month getting that dinner set up.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: For me or for you?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Are you that ungrateful?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I’m more grateful than you’1ll ever know. I didn't know you before, but now you’re my friend and if I had the means there's nothing I wouldn’t do for you if asked.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: The question still stands. Edward walks several paces away, hands in his pockets. Several moments pass...

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: She was born on a Sunday. I remember because there wasn’t a single cloud in the sky and I thought it was somehow appropriate... I know, cheesy right? (Carter just listens; this is Edward's joy) I managed to push her out of my mind the last few years, but after meeting your daughter-- And sometimes when I wake up in the morning... He sits down next to Carter. Takes an angry breath...  83.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Carl Okafor was an activist. Emily had joined some “save the poor people” thing and I guess they met and she decided she loved him... I saw him a few times. Good looking kid. Smart. Driven. But there was something about him I didn’t... Anyway, when she said they were engaged I told her I was against it. But, being my daughter, she went ahead anyway... We had some distance for a while, she’s as stubborn as her old man, but she seemed happy... The first time he hit her she came to me. I wanted to-- I wanted to beat him into the dirt until he begged for forgiveness...but she wouldn’t let me. She said it wasn’t his fault. He was broke. Had a few drinks. Said she picked the fight... I gave her some money and she went back to him. When the money ran out he did it again. She didn’t come to me that time.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: What did you do?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I did what any father would do. I got him a job. Administration in a small hospital in Great Neck. Gave him an office and a salary. Company car.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I don’t understand.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I let him get comfortable. Let him think he'd got it made until one night, when he was out banging one of the nurses, I had someone crack his computer and move a bunch of money around. The next morning he showed up for work and they arrested him on the spot. My lawyer’s a pitbull. Got him ten years for embezzlement.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: And Emily?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: She saw through me like glass. Cursed me out in front of the entire courtroom after his sentencing. Called me names you wouldn’t believe. Said I was dead to her. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But I figure, if that’s what it took... I grew up with nothing. I’m not proud of everything I’ve done but I’ve played by the rules for the most part. If my daughter hates me and they don’t let me into heaven...well then I guess that’s just life, isn’t it?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Happy endings are for suckers.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Yeah. They stare at the desert for a beat. Then Carter stands.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I got an addition to the list. They begin to climb down the stepped wall and WE PULL BACK to reveal that they have been sitting atop the peak of the Great Pyramid of Khufu this entire time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward follows Carter through the perfume section. Both are drinking cans of Coke as they pass wealthy, westernized Egyptians and tourists.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: What the hell did we just eat?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Don’t know. Don’t wanna know.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: If this is your idea of cheering me up...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: My brother pulled this once at Macy’s. Got him grounded for a week. I never had the guts... There. He makes for the elevators as a crowd shuffles inside.  85.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nearly full. Edward and Carter stand against the back wall.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Now?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Next floor.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: This isn’t very adult of you.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: It really isn’t. He smiles wickedly. The elevator doors open and more shoppers wedge themselves into the packed elevator. Edward and Carter are pressed into the wall.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Now?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Loser buys dinner. They both scrunch up their faces with effort. Carter’s teeth are gritted together until he suddenly burps drawing a look from the woman next to him.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Beg your pardon. The woman looks away. Edward’s fingertips are white as he presses his hands against the wall. Suddenly, the elevator is filled with the sound of--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the elevator doors open and the passengers erupt outward, pinching their noses, waving their hands and twittering angrily until the elevator is empty save for Carter and Edward who are on the floor in spasms of laughter until the doors close on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The laughter continues for several moments until--

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (waving his hand) Oh man that’s-- What did we just eat?  86. They break up again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward is asleep then suddenly chuckles in his dream. Carter looks over, smiling knowingly before laying a postcard of the pyramids on his seat-back table. Starts to write.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Dear Chambers Family... We’re on our way to India now. He thinks a moment before looking out the window at the sun painted table of clouds below and the endless blue above. CARTER (V.O.) (CONT’D) I can’t tell you how much I miss you all. This is a gift that you’ve given me and everything I’ve seen and done has been through your eyes and with you in my heart. I’m taking all my pills and I honestly haven’t felt this good in years. I hope you’re well and looking after your mother... “I love you” doesn’t come close... Dad. He replaces the cap on the pen and leans his head back on the seat. Edward suddenly laughs out loud and Carter can’t help but chuckle as he closes his eyes to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: The empress was the beloved wife of Shah Jehan, the fifth mughal emperor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter and Edward walk past murals depicting the history of the monument.  87.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: And though it was an arranged marriage, they were deeply in love and were inseparable until she died giving birth to their fourteenth child.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Fourteenth? That’s a lot of love.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: They didn’t write the Kama Sutra for nothing... It took twenty-thousand volunteers twenty-two years to complete the structure in sixteen forty-eight. Every square foot designed by Shah Jehan himself. They stop at a tile mural of the empress.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: So that’s true love.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Yeah. Edward reads Carter’s thoughts and quietly walks away leaving Carter to stare up at the mural.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward and Carter walk along the promenade beside the reflecting pools.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (trying to lighten the mood) You ever wonder why all the great historical monuments have to do with dead people?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Because they’re monuments. That’s what they’re for.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Yeah, but does being dead have to be a prerequisite? We can’t put up a tomb to the unborn soldier? “He would have died for his country if only his parents had been Catholic.”

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: You're losing your grip, aren't you?  88.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: My family’s got this plot upstate. My parents are there. Cousins. Grandparents. The whole shebang. We even got a little monument of our own.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: That where you want to end up?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I don’t know, I’m not sure they’d have me. I was a real pain in the ass when I was little. Hard to believe, I know. I dunno, it just seems so...colloquial.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I got it in my will. Want myself cremated and my ashes put in a can which they’1l bury somewhere with a view.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You mean an urn?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) I never liked the sound of it. “Urn.” Nope, an old can of Chock Full 0’ Nuts do me just fine.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Chock Full O--? The instant coffee?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Yup. Better coffee your money can’t buy.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I wouldn’t bet on that.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Ah yes, Kopi Luwak. You really dig that stuff, don’t you?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: It's the best. What do you got against it?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Much too fancy for my taste. Simple pleasures my man, simple pleasures.  89.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Think I might get another tattoo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seen from a distance as it looms across the hilltops. A sound is heard in the far off distance. We can’t quite make it out, but it clearly doesn’t belong. ANOTHER SECTION OF THE WALL; closer now. The sound is heard again, a faint buzzing. AT THE BASE OF THE WALL; the buzzing is closer now. It’s joined by voices. ATOP THE WALL; plunging down a hillside before us then surging back up to our position. The buzzing is louder still and the voices appear to be singing.

dialogues.speaker: VOICES, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Ah louie louie. Oh no. Say we gotta go. Yeah, yeah, yeah, yeah. Said ah louie louie-- And suddenly a motorcycle bursts into view up the hillside. Edward clings to Carter’s back as they ride down the center of the wall, roaring by us then disappearing down the opposite hillside. VOICES (0.S.) (CONT’D) --whoa baby! Said we gotta go. Yeah, yeah, yeah, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas stands with a disapproving look on his face as a guard leads Edward and Carter out of the cell. They’re dressed in filthy prison smocks with several weeks facial growth.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: This is becoming epidemic.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (shuffling past him) Shower.  90.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: (catching a whiff) Several.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas waits with a towel while Edward showers. Carter is seen through the doorway, talking to his family on the phone in the living room. He’s yet to shower.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: So what's the going rate for busting two Americans out of the Chinese clink?

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Ain’t what it used to be.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: That bad, huh?

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: You don’t want to know.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Actually, I do... Don’t I?

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: I’ve got your statements in my bag, but all told you're down to a couple million. Edward sticks his head through the shower door, halfway through shaving a new look that links his moustache to his sideburns.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You're joking me.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: I never joke with Civil War heroes. Nice ink, by the way. Edward holds up his arms which are now covered in tattoos: a charging bull, the pyramids, etc.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Like ‘em? One for each item on the list.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: How punk of you.  gl.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Thanks Thomas. Really, this is way above and beyond.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: What are indentured servants for. Heads into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Carter is just getting off the phone with his family.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: We're flying to Tibet tonight then next stop home. Alright. I will... Alright... Goodbye. Hangs up the phone leaving the receiver smeared with grime. Thomas grabs a tissue and starts wiping it.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Did you tell them?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (nods ) My wife wants me tested for syphilis. She’1l be sticking needles in me for days when I get back.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: You both seem in surprisingly good spirits considering...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I can’t explain it. I was telling Virginia. I feel...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Like a pigsty?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Young.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: They say your mental disposition can have a tremendous impact on disease.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: They can say what they want, just so long as he gets out of that shower soon. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Say, let me ask you something Thomas. Is it Thomas or Tommy?

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: It's Matthew actually but he finds that too biblical... Thomas is fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Edward emerges from the shower in a billowing cloud of steam.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: She’s all yours. He wipes steam from the mirror to reveal his new look: Kojak meets Founding Father. Admires himself appropriately. Notices the lesions have faded on his head.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, I said-- Sticks his head into the doorway to see Carter and Thomas whispering closely.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: I do, but I’m not sure he’1l---

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: He’1l what?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Ever think about flying coach back to the States. You know, save some for a rainy day.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You chumps want to ride with your knees in your throat that’s your business... Shower’s up.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Thank the lord. Runs into the bathroom peeling his shirt off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Edward and Carter take in the vista of hills rolling to the distant base of an impossibly enormous range of snow-covered mountains.  93.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Okay, it’s majestic.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: That’s nothing. Twelve thousand tops.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: What’s our mountain?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: We're only going to base camp, but the peak’s about twenty nine thousand feet. Edward whistles.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Why so many fatalities?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Hmmm?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: The air jockeys you were talking about. Ones that flew through the mountains.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: The hump pilots. Well, first off you had the Jap zeros which could ambush you from anywhere as you flew through the valleys. That was the easy part... When the weather came in, which was always, they couldn’t choke off the supply runs, so they flew in the soup... Sonar was all they had back then. They used to try to ping off the mountains to plot their course between ‘em. Sometimes it worked... Sixty years and they’re still finding wreckage up there.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Your uncle?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Two years on the hump. Not a scratch on him.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Lucky guy.  94.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Maybe... When the storms rolled in and he couldn’t see an inch past the windshield, he used to close his eyes and focus until he couldn't hear the copilot or even the engines. He’d focus until everything fell away except the mountains passing on either side. He could hear them and, ‘til the day he passed, he swore they could hear him in return.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: What did they sound like?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I asked him once. Near as he could figure- “Voice of god,” he said.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Wow, that’s... Is there anything in this world you don’t have a story about?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: It's called reading. You should try it someday... Here, you can start with this. Slams a book in Edward's chest, Gandhi an Autobiography: The Story of My Experiments With Truth.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: This some kind of yoga manual? Carter’s incredulous... Thomas comes up the steps. Edward tosses him the book.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here. Read this for me.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: So, shitty news or really shitty news?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: The first one.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: There’s a storm up there. They won’t fly until the weather clears.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (to Carter) Where’s your uncle when we need him.  95.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: They expect it to clear?

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Not for a month. Maybe two. That’s the really shitty news, in case you were wondering.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (disappointed) Next trip, huh? They know full well the remoteness of that possibility.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Definitely.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I guess it’s home then.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Maybe not.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: The climbing season’s almost--

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Everest isn’t the only majestic thing in the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spewing enormous plumes of ash and lava into the night sky while rivers of molten rock stream from the crater. Carter, Edward, and Thomas stand atop a neighboring peak. Their faces hang in awe in the light of the eruption.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (to Carter) What, no story? Carter just shakes his head. Edward smiles and turns back to the show. The ground rumbles. They feel it. Thomas grabs Edward's hand to steady him. Edward does the same with Carter. SEEN FROM BEHIND; in silhouette, the three friends stand hand-in-hand at the beginning and end of the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driving through the suburbs of New Jersey. Edward and Carter sit side by side in the back. Taking measure of what they’ve accomplished.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Thank you. Really.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Don’t be-- It’s nothing. It’s--

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: You're welcome, is what he’s trying to say.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Dead in a month my ass. They laugh and he looks out the window.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey Tommy, this isn’t Newark. You leave your compass back in Beijing? Thomas responds by putting up the divider between himself and the back seat. IN THE FRONT; Thomas exhales a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: One more stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pulling up in front of a small ranch house.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Why are we-- Thomas, you off the methadone? What the hell’s-- Stops as he sees something through the window. It’s a woman. She’s standing in the window of the ranch house, pacing back and forth as she talks on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: He kept tabs on her in case you ever wanted to--  97.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (livid) This was his idea?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: No, it was mine. Took the whole flight to talk him into it.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Hey Carter, will you do something for me?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Name it. Edward opens the door and climbs out of the car and walks briskly away from the house. Carter watches him go...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (softly) Go fuck myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward walks briskly through pools of light from the street lamps. The limo pulls up and Carter jumps out.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: This is what you want?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Telling someone a story doesn’t invite you to be a part of it. You had no right.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: You're right, I didn’t. But she’s still there. Maybe you took the long way home but this is the road’s end.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Go away. Walks past him. Carter follows.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: What are you so afraid of?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I'm not afraid of anything anymore. If you took a second to think it through you'd realize-- (stops walking) How did you see it? I knock on the door. She answers. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She’s surprised and angry but I tell her how much I love her and missed her, and gradually, piece by piece, the ice starts to thaw?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: It’s a start.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: No, it’s an end. Because you left one thing out. You didn’t think-- How is it fair that I show up after all this time and inject myself back into her life when I could be dead in a week?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: You just--

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: How do I tell her...without her believing that I’m only reaching out because I’m scared to die alone and didn’t care enough to consider what that would put her through.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Everyone’s afraid to die alone.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I’m not everyone.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Then you're kidding yourself.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: If I am, I’m not the only one.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: What’s that supposed--

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: What are you even doing here, Carter? You've got a family and a wife whose holding her heart in her hands while you’re flying around the world to “find the long way home.” Don’t you think she knows?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Knows what?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: That you blame her for your lack of accomplishment.  99.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Don’t you dare--

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: That you say things like you “wouldn’t trade your life with them for anything”, but deep down you question yourself, so you say those things because you know they’re the right thing to say, rather than what you really feel.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: You have no idea what I feel.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Maybe I don’t...but I know this. I love my daughter. If I didn’t I would be back there, knocking on her door. If you loved your wife, you wouldn’t have to go home because you’d have been there all along. He pulls out the Bucket List.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is fun, Carter. That’s all it ever was. Then he tears it in half, then again, and lets the pieces flutter to the sidewalk. He sees Thomas standing by the limo.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Call me after you've taken him home. He walks off. Carter stands there, staring at the pavement... Music begins; Jeff Buckley’s “Hallelujah” as Thomas walks around the limo and opens the door for Carter. Carter nods and walks towards him and then stops and turns to look at the Bucket List as the pieces scatter

dialogues.speaker: AS THE SONG PLAYS OVER...
dialogues.text: CARTER; walking up the steps to his house. He pauses at the door then opens it and carries his suitcase inside. EDWARD; hands in his pockets as he walks down a neighborhood street. The limo pulls up next to him and he climbs inside.  100. CARTER; in bed with his wife, each on their own side. Distance between them. . EDWARD; in his high-rise office sitting at his desk which faces the window with a view of the city shrouded in fog below. His hair is growing in again. He brings a coffee cup to his lips. It’s empty. CARTER; at the hospital getting a check-up. Holcomb comes in with test results. He’s amazed at Carter’s progress. Carter smiles as he buttons up his shirt. EDWARD; in his office kitchen. The box of Kopi Luwak is empty. He searches the cupboard finding only a can of instant. He puts the can back and walks out. CARTER; at the dinner table with his family. Virginia is saying grace. He’s watching her. She feels it and her eyes open. He reaches out and takes her hand. She smiles as their eyes hold each other and she continues to pray. EDWARD; shakes his head as he switches off the Yankee game. Moves to the bookshelf and browses until he removes a book on the Himalayas. VIRGINIA; waiting in the car for Carter. It’s autumn now and the windows are painted with frost. A finger appears, drawing letters on the windshield. WILL YOU MARRY ME? EDWARD; working out on the elliptical machine at the gym. It's late and the place is empty. CARTER AND VIRGINIA; standing in the center of a shopping mall, their friends and family around them as they renew their vows. EDWARD; stepping out of the shower. Wipes the steam from the mirror revealing his full head of hair and the journal of tattoos over his body. He touches the erupting volcano on his forearm. CARTER; home in bed staring at a small plastic bull. He puts it away as Virginia comes in, dressed in her nightgown. She climbs in bed and he reaches across and pulls her to him.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGINIA
dialogues.text: Happy second honeymoon.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Happy second honeymoon.  101. They kiss. His hands move to her hips under the covers.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGINIA
dialogues.text: Do you have any idea how long it’s been?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Do I want to know?

dialogues.speaker: VIRGINIA
dialogues.text: No, I don’t think you do.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I love you, ‘Gin.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGINIA
dialogues.text: I know you do.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: It wasn’t that I ever stopped loving you so much as I forgot the reasons you loved me. (she touches his face) Remember that night, when I took you to the Bowl-O-Rama over on fourteenth street?

dialogues.speaker: VIRGINIA
dialogues.text: How do you think I could forget our first date? You wore that shirt with the stain on the front and your black shoes and brown belt.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: And you wore a blue dress with little bows down the back.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGINIA
dialogues.text: (surprised) I can’t believe you--

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I was so out of my league. I remember thinking, “What’s a girl looks like this doing slumming with a kid who's best shirt got a stain on the front?”

dialogues.speaker: VIRGINIA
dialogues.text: You weren’t worthy.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I’ve never been worthy of you.  102.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGINIA
dialogues.text: I was joking, baby. I knew that night after I got back. I told my mother I was your’s forever if you’d have me... Forever’s just getting started. They kiss again, more passionately until she pulls away and stands out of bed.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGINIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I got something for you. Wasn’t sure I'd need it.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Don’t be long now. She goes into the bathroom and closes the door halfway. We see her feet stepping out of her pajamas and into something black and lacy. When the door opens her hair is down and spilling over her shoulders and a thin, satin negligee.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGINIA
dialogues.text: Carter? The bed is empty. She walks around it.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGINIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So we’re playing games now? You think you can get me all riled up then-- She stops as she sees him face down on the floor, his hands twitching.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGINIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Carter! She turns him over to see his eyes are rolled back into his head as the seizure storms through him.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGINIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Roger! She finds his wallet on the bedside table and forces it between his teeth. Roger appears at the door--

dialogues.speaker: ROGER
dialogues.text: What’s the--  103. He sees his father on the floor then runs for the phone. Rachel and Lee appear. Lee runs to help Virginia as Rachel stands in the doorway watching her father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward and his date, AMERY, a pretty middle-aged woman sit at a table against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: It’s Bruno’s specialty. It’s not on the menu.

dialogues.speaker: AMERY
dialogues.text: That’s a lot of food.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I’m a bottomless pit. Besides, I’m in training.

dialogues.speaker: AMERY
dialogues.text: Isn’t mountain climbing dangerous?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: For someone my age? You can say it. She's interrupted by the MAITRE’D who walks briskly to the table.

dialogues.speaker: MAITRE'D
dialogues.text: I’m sorry Mister Cole. It’s your driver. He says it’s urgent. Edward turns to the front door where Thomas stands. His face says everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward emerges from the elevator and walks pointedly towards his old room. Passes Holcomb at the nurse’s station.

dialogues.speaker: DR. HOLCOMB
dialogues.text: (walking after him) Edward.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: When did this happen?  104.

dialogues.speaker: DR. HOLCOMB
dialogues.text: It came out of nowhere but it’s his brain and the tumors are deep.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: So you can operate?

dialogues.speaker: DR. HOLCOMB
dialogues.text: Day after tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: And he'll be alright?

dialogues.speaker: DR. HOLCOMB
dialogues.text: In his condition it’s not-- The odds aren’t what we’d like them to be. Edward sees there’s little hope. Resumes walking into--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Carter is back in bed covered in tubes. Virginia lies with Rachel on the bed next to him. Rachel is asleep.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: How is he?

dialogues.speaker: VIRGINIA
dialogues.text: Quiet. I wasn’t sure if I should call you, I--

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Of course. Please. Is there anything I can do for you? Are the boys--

dialogues.speaker: VIRGINIA
dialogues.text: We're fine. Really... He wanted me to give you this. She sits up and pulls the taped-together Bucket List out of her purse.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGINIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There’s a letter too. I was supposed to wait until... But then I thought--

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: --she’s never listened to me before, why let a coupl’a tumors get in the way. Edward sits down on the side of his bed.  105.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’s with all the hair?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: How they treating you?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Food still sucks.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I’ll talk to the owner.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I wouldn’t, I hear he’s a prick.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: He definitely has his moments... Edward nods. It’s all under the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (holds the List) What was I going to do with this?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: It isn’t finished.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: It’s not a one man job.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: It's going to have to be. Edward scans the remaining items. Stops on one of them.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: No it doesn’t... I’1l be-- (heads for the door) Don’t go anywhere. Runs out. EXT. HOLCOMB’S OFFICE - NIGHT Holcomb’s packing up for the night when Edward enters, speaking on his cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I don’t care how, just get a hold of him and call me back. He snaps the phone shut and glares at Holcomb.  106.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can he be moved without hurting him?

dialogues.speaker: DR. HOLCOMB
dialogues.text: Well, technically yes, but--

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I’m taking him out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward walks with Holcomb trailing him. Thomas stands as he sees them.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Pull the car up front.

dialogues.speaker: DR. HOLCOMB
dialogues.text: I cannot allow you to sneak him out again. I could be personally liable-- As Edward slams him into the wall.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Plain English. I’m taking my friend out of here and you’re coming with us. You've got ten minutes to pack what you need or I will personally ask Thomas to rearrange your kidneys. Thomas smiles at Holcomb who nods abruptly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward enters just as Carter is standing out of bed with help from Virginia.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: How fast can you get him dressed?

dialogues.speaker: VIRGINIA
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I can dress my own damn self. Where we going?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: One more trip. (to Virginia) Can I talk to you? (to Carter) Pack it up. We’re not home yet.  107. He ushers Virginia out into the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The limo doors open and Thomas emerges along with Edward, Holcomb and the entire Chambers family. Carter is weak but shuffles along towards the waiting Gulfstream.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: If you could step it up we’re kind of on a schedule.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I'll step it up when you tell me where we're going.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Roger.

dialogues.speaker: ROGER
dialogues.text: Sorry dad. As he lifts his father into his arms and carries him towards the plane.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Boy, put me down. Whose side are you on!

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (to Lee) Does he ever stop talking?

dialogues.speaker: LEE
dialogues.text: Only when he’s eating.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Well, that I can relate to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zipping between large warehouses. Carter sits in the back with Virginia. He’s blindfolded and bitching and wearing a new suit. Edward’s in the front next to the driver. The golf cart pulls to a stop next to a warehouse door. Virginia helps Carter out while Edward gets the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doorway is curtained off with thick, sound-eating drapes. Virginia leads Carter inside.  108.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: You're enjoying this, aren’t you? Muffled clapping is heard from the other side of the curtains. A man in a BASEBALL CAP pushes through an opening.

dialogues.speaker: BASEBALL CAP
dialogues.text: Great. We’re ready for you.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Who the hell’s he talking to?

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: And now our contestants entering the studio: a college professor from Gladwyne, Pennsylvania, Deenaz Olpadwala. Edward removes the blindfold and pushes Carter through the curtains. ON CARTER; As his eyes adjust then light up as a familiar theme plays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The real deal, replete with a live studio audience.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Our second contestant.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: How in the world did you--?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I had a couple million lying around.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: A garage mechanic from Newark, New Jersey...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: But that’s all you had--

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: So go earn it back.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Carter Chambers.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: You son of a bitch.  109. He straightens his tie and walks purposefully towards his podium. Roger, Lee and Rachel cheer him on from the stands as he nervously takes his place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The game is underway. ALEX TREBEK calls the clues...

dialogues.speaker: ALEX TREBEK
dialogues.text: This sophistic monk is often credited as one of the causes of the Russian Revolution. Carter hits the button but his timing is off.

dialogues.speaker: DEENAZ
dialogues.text: Who is Rasputin?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX TREBEK
dialogues.text: Correct.

dialogues.speaker: DEENAZ
dialogues.text: I’‘ll take Mad Men for two hundred.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX TREBEK
dialogues.text: An animated character with a predilection for tall headwear... Carter.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: The Mad Hatter.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX TREBEK
dialogues.text: No... Sherman. SHERMAN, the bookish current champion clears his throat.

dialogues.speaker: SHERMAN
dialogues.text: Who is the Mad Hatter?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX TREBEK
dialogues.text: Yes. Edward stands anxiously with Virginia.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Get it together. Virginia shushes him.

dialogues.speaker: SHERMAN
dialogues.text: Mad Men for three-hundred.  110.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX TREBEK
dialogues.text: This King of England earned his maligned nickname in part by conversing with a tree he believed to be the King of Prussia.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Who is King George?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX TREBEK
dialogues.text: Can you be more specific?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Who is “Mad” King George the third.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX TREBEK
dialogues.text: Correct. Virginia grabs Edward. The Chambers kids cheer.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX TREBEK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Carter takes control of the board.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I’1l take Mad Men for four-hundred, Alex. A SERIES OF CUTS; as Carter begins to run the board. His answers are quick and on the mark. The other contestants get an answer here and there but the game is clearly Carter’s to win. Roger, Lee and Rachel continue to cheer him on. Virginia's grip on Edward’s arm grows tighter and tighter until he winces.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGINIA
dialogues.text: Oh. Sorry. (Carter gets another answer) Go on, baby! She’s punches Edward’s arm in glee. The game continues. Carter is doing well but he’s beginning to tire. Sweat stains are visible on his collar. Edward now stands several feet away from Virginia.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Is he okay?

dialogues.speaker: VIRGINIA
dialogues.text: He'll be fine.  111. She applauds as he gets another correct answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The game is down to Final Jeopardy. The final category is on the board:

dialogues.speaker: ALEX TREBEK
dialogues.text: The category is World Monuments and the final clue is-- The clue is revealed...

dialogues.speaker: ALEX TREBEK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (reading) This mughal emperor built the Taj Mahal to memorialize the death of his wife, Empress Mumtaz Mahal. Edward smiles as the Final Jeopardy theme plays.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: It’s in the bag. His grin begins to subside as he watches Carter wipe a think band of sweat from his forehead. CARTER’S POV; is blurred as his hand slips on the pen. He closes his eyes to steady himself, but his vision is blurred even further.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGINIA
dialogues.text: Edward.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I see it. He starts circling the stage, crossing behind the cameras to get closer to the contestants. Carter scribbles loosely on the screen but drops the pen and falls just as Edward gets there to catch him. FADE TO WHITE. Voices are heard...

dialogues.speaker: HOLCOMB, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: .-..-do our best, but it’s too far along.  112.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Anything you need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter’s POV as Virginia stares down at him.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGINIA
dialogues.text: Hey, babe. Can you hear me all right?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (dazed) Wha- Where time is it? His face is paralyzed on one side. His head is shaved and heavily marked with surgery markers.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGINIA
dialogues.text: We're in the hospital. You had a stroke, but you’re gonna be fine.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Where’s Alex?

dialogues.speaker: VIRGINIA
dialogues.text: (looking) Who’s Alex?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: He's probably sleeping. It’s almost midnight.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGINIA
dialogues.text: They’re taking you in for surgery in a minute.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I’ll leave you two alone.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Wait. (to Virginia) My bag. She reaches for his overnight bag.  113.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can you-- She opens it for him. He reaches inside and pulls out a sealed envelope and a folded slip of paper.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Got any of that coffee left?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I’m all out. I can see if there’s anywhere that sells it out here, but--

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (smiles) Not if I was dying of thirst in the desert... Wanna know why?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: “I'm sure you'll enlighten me.” Carter hands the paper to Edward.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Read.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (reading) Kopi Luwak is the world’s most expensive coffee, though, for some, it falls under the category of too good to be true. In the village where the beans are grown lives a breed of wild African tree-cats. The cats eat the beans, digest them, then... (a beat; he swallows) ...then defecate them out for the villagers to collect. It’s the gastric juices of the cat that give the coffee its unique flavor and absence of aftertaste... You’re shitting me?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Cats beat me to it. He bursts into weak laughter. Edward stares for a moment then starts to chuckle himself. Soon both men are laughing until tears stream down their cheeks. As he laughs, Edward's tears become gradually laced with grief as he hold’s Carter's wrist.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Still have the list?  114.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Of course. (pulls it out along with the red pen) There’s only a few left. Which one do you want to do next? Carter runs a finger down the items, until he reaches “LAUGH UNTIL I CRY.” He crosses it off shakily with the pen. Only four remain. His finger stops on the half finished “#11) GET BACK IN TOUCH” Edward sees this.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: There's a difference between dying alone and living like you're already dead... Finish the list, Edward. He places the envelope atop the list.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward emerges through the sliding doors. He wipes the tears flowing from his face, unsure of where to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Holcomb enters, scrubbed for surgery, with several nurses.

dialogues.speaker: DR. HOLCOMB
dialogues.text: We're ready. Carter reaches out for Virginia’s hand and presses it to his heart.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGINIA
dialogues.text: I’ll be here when you get back.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Forever’s just getting started. Her hand slips out of his as he’s wheeled out of the room.  115.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward loses himself in the raindrops sliding down the window as the plane readies for takeoff. He glances down at the envelope in his lap and turns it over. On the front is his name and address. He thinks a moment, steeling himself before he opens it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter lies unconscious with a tube in his mouth as the surgeons do their work. In contrast to Edward, he looks completely at peace.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Dear Edward. It’s turning cold out here in Newark and the trees are like skeletons beneath the lamp posts. Winter’s almost upon us and despite what the doctors tell me, I know it will be my last.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seen from the Hudson, the mandala of lights reflect like jewels in the water. Carter sits on the edge of a pier taking in the view...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You know how I love to tell stories so if you can spare a few minutes I think I’ve got a good one for you... He returns to the letter in his lap, and resumes writing...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: There was an old farmer spent his life working the earth to give his family all the cares and comforts he’d never had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward reads the words as Carter speaks them.  116.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: One day the farmer fell sick and he called his sons to his bedside where he took up a bundle of sticks and said to his eldest son, "Show me that you can break it.” The son strained and strained, but with all his efforts was unable to break the bundle. Edward finishes the letter and wipes the tears from his cheeks. The flashing wing lights of the plane reflect the raindrop on the window indelibly onto his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seen from above as Roger, Lee and Rachel lie in bed with their mother, clinging to her as she prays.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The other sons also tried, but none of them could break it. "Untie the bundle," said the farmer, "And each of you take a stick."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Edward walks up the path to his daughter’s house. He knocks on the door without hesitation.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: When they had done so, he called out to them, "Now, break them," and each stick was easily broken... The door opens revealing Emily. She’s surprised and her sleepy features harden instantly. Edward begins to talk.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: No man is an island, my friend. We’re just not built that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Virginia scoops instant coffee into a styrofoam cup. She looks up as Holcomb appears at the other end of the hallway walking towards her. His face is unreadable.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You measure yourself by the people who measure themselves by you, and no matter how you battle the current--  117. EXT. EMILY’S HOUSE - DAWN Thomas leans against the limo, watching through the window as Carter and Emily speak. Her guard is still up, but she’s listening...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: --our lives are streams flowing into the same river towards whatever heaven lies in the mist beyond the falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can’t see Holcomb’s face or what he’s saying as he reaches Virginia, but her expression says it all. The coffee cup slips from her hands and lands at her feet, spilling onto the floor.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Find the joy in your life, Edward. Close your eyes and let the waters take you. INT. EMILY’S HOUSE - DAWN Edward shakes Emily’s hand goodbye. She’s not giving in, but it’s a start. He reaches for the front door just as a LITTLE GIRL, still half-asleep, comes out from the back bedroom. Edward is stunned.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Open your heart and listen to the mountain... He looks up at Emily who says something to the little girl. He crouches down as the girl walks right up to him and lays her head on his shoulder. His eyes are full as he looks up at Emily in amazement then slowly kisses his granddaughter’s head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter's face is at peace. Virginia’s face comes into frame and kisses him softly. Her tears fall onto his eyelids and continue down his cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I promise you’ll be heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
